In addition, the unique network telemetry capabilities of Ziftenâs Zflow which enables the creation of Netflow on any x86 OS-based device (Windows, Mac and Linux), giving a unique solution for east â west traffic visibility as your workloads are moved between on-premises, hybrid and Cloud.

en.extension_short_description: An app that integrates TRIAM's Threat Intelligence Platform with QRadar.
en.extension_long_description: The T-Eye App for QRadar facilitates the delivery of threat indicators from TRIAM's T-Eye Threat Intelligence Platform to our customers' QRadar instances. It fetches the feeds in real-time and updates the reference sets in QRadar. With the help of various indicators along with their different feed types, it can generate reference sets on the basis of which rules are triggered. Moreover, it can also create default reference sets and associate T-Eye rules with them.

STEALTHbits Active Directory security monitoring solution enables organizations to successfully, efficiently, and affordably monitor and prevent Active Directory changes, authentications, and attacks in real-time, without any reliance on native logging or security controls. Using the preconfigured STEALTHbits Active Directory App for QRadar, users can quickly understand all Active Directory changes as a whole, patterns of activity indicative of account compromise, as well as attempts to compromise security through the ability to block undesired changes and access. See the Data Sheet for more information. Note that StealthINTERCEPT must be installed within your environment and configured to send logs to QRadar for this application to work correctly, and a full deploy may be required after installing.

en.extension_long_description:
**Description**  
By integrating Resilient's Security Orchestration, Automation and Response (SOAR) Platform with IBM QRadar, security teams are empowered to simplify and streamline the process of escalating and managing incidents. When offenses are escalated from IBM QRadar into Resilient, the SOAR platform generates a detailed, incident-specific response plan that enables team members to quickly respond.  
**Key Features**  
- automatically or manually escalate a QRadar offense to a Resilient incident  
- map Resilient incident fields to QRadar offense fields using JINJA2 templating syntax and filters
- query/add Resilient artifacts to QRadar reference sets
- synchronize notes between Resilient incidents and QRadar offenses
- close QRadar offenses and Resilient incidents simultaneously
**new in v3.3.0**
- multi-org support to work in conjunction with Resilient's v33 MSSP add-on
- bug fixes and improvements

Palo Alto Networks and IBM have partnered to deliver advanced security reporting and analytics to the widely used IBM QRadar SIEM. Integrate QRadar seamlessly with the Palo Alto Networks platform to streamline operations and improve security. The Palo Alto Networks app for QRadar enables these capabilities by allowing the security operations team to reduce, prioritize, and correlate Palo Alto Networks events using the QRadar dashboard, and leverage offenses and offense workflows created automatically, enabling rapid response to the most critical threats from a single dashboard.

en.extension_long_description:
The IBM Security QRadar User Behavior Analytics (UBA) app provides an efficient means for detecting anomalous or malicious behaviors. The QRadar UBA app provides a lens into deviation in user behavior to detect and prioritize risky user activities, and to quickly show who is doing what on your networks. The QRadar UBA app comes with ready-to-go anomaly detection, behavioral rules and analytics, and leverages the curated log and activity data already in QRadar, thereby speeding time to insights. By streamlining monitoring, detection, and investigation, the QRadar UBA app helps security analysts become more productive and manage insider threats more efficiently. Read more:  
[UBA PDF](https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SS42VS_latest/com.ibm.UBAapp.doc/b_Qapps_UBA.pdf)  
[UBA online documentation](https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SS42VS_latest/com.ibm.UBAapp.doc/c_Qapps_UBA_intro.html)  
    
[UBA set up video on the IBM Security Learning Academy](https://www.securitylearningacademy.com/enrol/index.php?id=3424)  
[Additional UBA videos and lab on the IBM Security Learning Academy](https://www.securitylearningacademy.com/local/navigator/index.php?level=siub01)  

**After you upgrade UBA from an older version, clear your browser cache and refresh the browser window before you use the QRadar UBA app.**  

**The memory requirement for UBA 3.4 increased to 1.2 GB.**  

**The IBM Sense Analytics DSM (available through Autoupdate or Fix Central) must be installed or updated prior to installing the QRadar UBA app.**

1.0.1:
The ability to create rule actions that post information on threats on your system to a TAXII inbox service, so you can share information with a wider community.
Support for JSON authentication tokens
Support for SSL and SNI authentication
Support for unauthenticated connections
1.0.2: Fixed an issue where certain observable types were not captured by the app. This issue led polls to be returned without data.
1.4.1: Added GDPR compliance by separating logs into daily log files and deleting them every 30 days.
1.3.0: Threat Intelligence users now have unlimited free access to X-Force Exchange feeds.
Fixed an issue where feeds that use threat intelligence with a proxy that contains a user name and password failed to work.
Fixed an issue where inbox service names were included in collections.
Fixed an issue where if a poll failed, the app continued to repoll the feed, which prevented other feeds from polling.
Fixed an issue where the app didn't recognize some root certificate authorities.
Fixed an issue where the edit feed didn't work when the client certificate was specified.
Fixed an issue where the feed for the XFE Url Report collection didn't work because the app didn't support a way to enter a valid URL when the feed was added.
Improved error handling.
1.2.0:
Added capabilities for editing threat feeds and rule actions
Clarified the descriptions in the Poll Initial Date field when you edit a threat feed
Fixed an issue where the app feed couldn't connect to and HTTP feed using a proxy
Minor fixes
1.4.2: Added the ability to install the app offline after you download it from the IBM Security App Exchange.
1.4.3: Added the ability to upload a client key for client certificates for TAXII feeds (for example, the U.S. Department of Homeland Security)
Enhanced password authentication to allow special characters
1.4.4:
Improved performance by limiting TAXII feed polling to one feed at a time. For more information, see
Polling TAXII feeds.

Added email as an observable type when you add a TAXII feed. For more information, see Adding threat
intelligence feeds.
Migrated to Python 2.7 to fix certificate errors.

en.extension_long_description:
Threat Intelligence for IBM QRadar enables you to pull in any threat intelligence feed using the open standard STIX and TAXII formats, and to deploy the data to create custom rules for correlation, searching, and reporting. For example, you can use the App to import public collections of dangerous IP addresses from IBM X-Force Exchange and create a rule to raise the magnitude of any offense that includes IP addresses from that watch list.  

**Threat Intelligence users now have unlimited free access to X-Force Exchange feeds from v1.3.0 app install.**

The 'Product' custom event property for Stonesoft Management Center has been optimized, which allows administrators to use the custom event property 'Product' in searches, reports, and rules. en.extension_short_description: QRadar extension to add eight custom event properties.

Custom event properties allow users to leverage their event data more efficiently in searches or reports. New custom event properties include: Attribute Old Value, Affected Object, Attribute Name, Attribute New Value, Class Name, Distinguished Name, Operation Type, and Setting Name. Read more

Import contextual identity information from multiple identity sources into QRadar. The app polls one or more LDAP servers for user data and adds it to new or existing reference data in QRadar. Easily focus your investigations on specific groups, identify users by department, office or any other information available in LDAP. [Read more](https://ibm.biz/BdszpQ)

2.5.1: Performance and scalability improvements: support up to 400,000 users.
1.2.0:
Added a default configuration for Active Directory that eliminates the need to enter values for LDAP configurations.
Defect fixes
3.1.1: Added the ability to import user information from a csv file into a QRadar reference table.
3.2.1: Enhanced the configuration so you can easily select the attributes to extract from the LDAP server.
Improved configuration field validation and LDAP attribute processing.
2.0.0: Added globalization support for the following languages: Brazilian Portuguese, French, German, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Spanish, Simplified Chinese, Russian, and Turkish.
Defect fixes
1.1.0:
Added LDAP attribute mapping - LDAP attribute mapping allows you to provide a different name for use when storing attributes within a reference table. This can be useful when merging data from different LDAP sources into a common data set.
Added Record retrieval limit - You can limit the number of records that are retrieved for an LDAP search.
Added support for RFC 2696, LDAP paged requests - If your LDAP server limits the number of records that can be returned for each poll, you can configure the LDAP app to use paged results to avoid this limitation.
UI design refresh - The look of the Reference Data Import - LDAP app UI is updated, and simplified.

* IP with Multiple MAC Addresses
* DMZ Reverse Tunnel

en.extension_short_description: AlgoSec Incident Response extension for Resilient - add business and network context, isolate compromised servers
en.extension_long_description:
AlgoSec’s business-driven security policy management solution helps make enterprises more agile, secure and compliant. 

AlgoSec provides holistic visibility across the entire network security infrastructure, including business applications and their connectivity flows. 
With AlgoSec users can auto-discover application connectivity, proactively analyze risk from the business perspective, and intelligently automate time-consuming security changes—all with zero-touch, and seamlessly orchestrated across any heterogeneous environment. 

Through AlgoSec’s integration with Resilient, this extension enhances and automates the Security Incident Response process by: 

* Augmenting security incident data with business application context 
* Identifying network connectivity to/from a compromised server 
* Automatically isolating a compromised server from the network

en.extension_short_description: A developer portal to enable users to register their own applications and be issued a client ID.
en.extension_long_description:
OAuth as a protocol delegates the authorization decision to the resource owner, which means that
the consumer of a given resource does not need to be explicitly permitted to access that resource
up to the moment that an authorization is requested (and thus the resource owner is prompted
if they permit this authorization decision). 
What this means is that OAuth is well suited to third-
party API consumption, allowing an unknown or not highly trusted entity to request and potentially
consume APIs on behalf of a user.
In order for an application to consume APIs on behalf of a user, it requires a client-id , which is
used to identify to the authorization server that is requesting access. The method by which these
client IDs are issued to users is not defined well; an administrator might be responsible for creating
the client and providing the details to the application owner in an out-of-band way. This process
can be cumbersome, particularly in a world that is shifting its focus to cloud.

Read more at https://www.ibm.com/blogs/security-identity-access/2018/06/oauth-building-developer-portal/

en.extension_short_description: Indegy enables operational engineers and cyber security personnel to gain control over industrial-networks.
en.extension_long_description:
Today's Industrial Control Systems (ICS) quite literally control our lives. However, while they were once isolated from any other part of the organization or network and considered static systems, it is no longer the case. They are connected to the enterprise and IT systems which are vulnerable to malware, cyber attacks, insider threat, misconfigurations and even failed maintenance. Existing security solutions to not address these ICS threats thus putting the organization and the people that rely on it at risk.

The Joint Solution: Indegy & IBM QRadar
The Indegy platform is purpose-built to provide real-time situational awareness for ICS networks. Industrial & critical infrastructure facilities implement Indegy to gain comprehensive visibility, security and control over ICS devices used to automate operational processes and protect them from cyber attacks, insider threats and human error.
The Indegy Security Suite combines behavioral anomaly detection with policy based rules for delivering the most comprehensive threat detection and mitigation, and unique visibility into the asset inventory. The joint solution between Indegy and IBM QRadar (SIEM) provides unprecedented visibility of both the IT as well as OT environments. The integration is supported on IBM QRadar by a Device Support Module (DSM) which parses received OT events from Indegy’s Security Suite and converts them to a standard taxonomy format that can be displayed on IBM’s QRadar.

Joint Value Proposition
• Visibility across IT and OT environments
• Behavioral and advanced heuristics
• Policy based controls
• Identification of vulnerabilities
• Complete and real-time device inventory
• Asset tracking
• Proactive security and compliance reporting

The Indegy Value
Indegy is the world’s only ICS Security solution providing two layers of monitoring, for full visibility, security and control into network communications as well as device state Threat Detection & Mitigation that combines behavioral anomalies with policy based rules.
Asset Tracking that goes as far as dormant devices and as deep as PLC back-plane configurations.
Vulnerability Management that tracks and scores patch & risk levels of ICS devices.
Configuration Control that tracks all changes to code, OS & firmware regardless if done through the network or locally.
Enterprise Visibility to ensure that all data collected by Indegy integrates to your single pane of glass.

en.extension_short_description: QRadar Extension to ingest CrowdStrike Falcon EndPoint detections into QRadar
en.extension_long_description:
The CrowdStrike Falcon EndPoint Extension for QRadar will enable easy integration of CrowdStrike's Falcon Platform into QRadar. It integrates with CrowdStrike's Streaming API to ingest all detections generated from the Falcon Platform.  Data fields are automatically mapped between CrowdStrike and QRadar. Also included is the ability to update CrowdStrike detection from the QRadar interface ensuring both systems stay up to date using CrowdStrike's detection management APIs.

Harness the power of big data and artificial intelligence to empower your team with instant visibility and protection across the entire threat lifecycle.

**Note**  
Supported QRadar platforms
- IBM® Security QRadar® 7.2.8: Patch 14 (7.2.8.20181017162208)
- IBM® Security QRadar® 7.3.1: Patch 7 (7.3.1.20181123182336)
- Please ensure your QRadar console version is greater than or equal to those stated above.

en.extension_name: Cb Response Integration for IBM Resilient
en.extension_long_description: The IBM Resilient - Carbon Black Response (Cb Response) integration creates a seamless connection between your Resilient IRP environment and Cb Response. As artifacts are added to a Resilient incident (e.g. hashes, IP addresses, domains, file names), lookups are automatically made into Cb Response to determine what endpoint data Carbon Black has centrally recorded about that artifact. Then, a results summary of this lookup are stored in the Resilient console so that within seconds, from a single pane of glass, a security analyst working in Resilient can see exactly how the artifact has shown up in the environment. From there, the analyst can perform actions such as banning a malicious file or pivoting in to a visualization of the attack in the Carbon Black console. This seamless integration speeds up the time it takes to resolve incidents and improves the effectiveness of the security team.
en.extension_short_description: This seamless integration speeds up the time it takes to resolve incidents and improves security effectiveness.

en.extension_short_description: Corrata helps to protect your organization against mobile threats and enforce compliance with acceptable use policies.
en.extension_long_description:
Even with Mobile Device Management systems in place, your organization's mobile devices are exposed to multiple threats from social engineering, malware, and insecure Wi-Fi.

Corrata provides the best available protection against mobile threats by detecting and blocking any device attempting to connect to phishing sites, malicious hosts, unofficial app stores or CnC servers.

Corrata’s unique Zero Gateway architecture avoids the privacy and user experience drawbacks of proxy or VPN based solutions.

**Mobile Device Security and Compliance**

Mobile devices are at the heart of how every organization is run today. Mobile devices are also the new frontier in the fight against cyber crime. Organizations need to urgently upgrade their cyber defenses to combat the rising tide of mobile threats, such as:
* **Mobile Phishing** - People are far more likely to fall for phishing attacks on mobile than on desktop. Mobile presents multiple mechanisms for phishing attacks: email, SMS, social media such as Twitter or LinkedIn, and messaging apps like WhatsApp and Facebook Messenger.
* **Malware Infection** - Hundreds of vulnerabilities continue to be found in both iOS and Android leaving them exposed to malware infection. Malicious apps continue to make their way onto official and unofficial app stores. This leaves sensitive data on mobile devices at serious risk.
* **Data Leakage** - Security weaknesses in connectivity technologies such as Wi-Fi and Bluetooth, together with patchy encryption, means your data is at risk. The uncontrolled use of unapproved cloud services by employees is another way in which sensitive information can leak.

Corrata’s solution detects and prevents attacks at the network level and proactively scans for vulnerabilities at the device level. Corrata provides the best available protection against mobile threats by detecting and blocking any device attempting to connect to phishing sites, malicious hosts, unofficial app stores or CnC servers. 
* **Threat Protection** - Corrata protects against the full range of phishing attacks on mobile: email, SMS, social media, and app based. Malicious sites and content are also filtered, and downloads from unofficial app stores are blocked. Corrata also scans each mobile device to check for Indicators of Compromise.
* **Status** - Corrata detects compromised devices, apps, and infrastructure by analyzing a comprehensive set of indicators including network traffic, operating system patch status, and configuration settings.
* **Compliance** - Corrata can be configured to enforce your organization’s acceptable use policies by blocking access to content deemed inappropriate in a work environment.
* **Zero Gateway Architecture** - Corrata leverages recent developments in mobile device technology to implement a ground-breaking Zero Gateway architecture. Corrata’s solution examines all network traffic before it enters or leaves the device preventing connections with suspicious or non-compliant hosts. This avoids the privacy, confidentiality and user experience drawbacks inherent in VPN or proxy-based solutions which require all device traffic to be routed through an inline gateway.

**Data Usage Control**
Enterprise mobile data use is growing rapidly, driven by the high bandwidth requirements of video streaming in popular entertainment and social media apps. Without proper controls, organizations are exposed to unnecessary costs due to excessive non-business use of corporate paid for mobile devices.

Corrata addresses these challenges through its solution to manage mobile data usage. Corrata’s rich feature set enables any organization to establish and apply mobile data usage policies tailored to their corporate culture and business needs.
* **Mobile Data Control** - Corrata makes it easy to set daily and/or monthly caps for non-business domestic and roaming usage. High-bandwidth entertainment apps can be blacklisted from using mobile data but allowed over Wi-Fi, while business critical apps can be whitelisted so employees can always get the job done. Policies can be tailored to the needs of different types of employee - executives, office based, field base, etc.
* **Visibility** - Corrata provides real-time visibility of employee mobile data usage broken down by category, location and if required, by site and application. 
* **Employee Empowerment** - The Corrata App for iOS and Android provides employees with real time analysis of their data usage and gives timely advice around how to avoid unnecessary costs.

**MaaS360 Integration**
Corrata has provided tools for customers with an existing IBM MaaS360 account to easily and quickly import all users and devices from MaaS360. Policies groups from MaaS360 can also be mapped to Corrata Policies, saving time. Once all the devices are imported, invites can be sent out to each device and the users can set up Corrata on their devices quickly and easily.

en.extension_name: IBM Security Access Manager HSM Extension for SafeNet Luna Network
en.extension_short_description: This extension can be used to install the SafeNet Luna Network HSM driver files onto the ISAM appliance.
en.extension_long_description:
The [SafeNet Luna Network Hardware Security Module](https://safenet.gemalto.com/data-encryption/hardware-security-modules-hsms/safenet-network-hsm/) provides storage, protection and management of your cryptographic keys.

This extension will add the SafeNet drivers to the appliance so that it is able to integrate and communicate with a SafeNet Luna Network HSM device.

The following driver versions are currently supported: 
* v5.4.1-2
* v7.3.0-165

The driver files which are required for this extension should be obtained from the Luna Client package.  Please contact your Vendor to obtain a copy of this package.

The following 64-bit RPM files are required by this extension (replace 'x.x.x-x' with the driver version number, eg: '7.3.0-165'): 
* configurator-x.x.x-x.x86_64.rpm
* libcryptoki-x.x.x-x.x86_64.rpm
* libshim-x.x.x-x.x86_64.rpm
* lunacm-x.x.x-x.x86_64.rpm
* lunacmu-x.x.x-x.x86_64.rpm
* vtl-x.x.x-x.x86_64.rpm

Please note that this extension is only supported on ISAM v9.0.7.0 and later.

en.extension_short_description: Patching made easy.
en.extension_long_description:
Patching made easy.  Start and stop the fileserver, upload, install, and schedule patches without having to use the CLI.

**Features:**
- No Command Line Interface (CLI) needed to view, upload, install, and schedule patches.
- Convenience links to quickly download patches directly from Fix Central.
- Start and stop the fileserver with the click of a button; easily upload patches.
- Step-by-step instructions.
- View installed, scheduled, and missing appliance patches.  

**Notes:**
- Tested on 10.5 and 10.6 versions of Guardium (app may work on other versions).
- Requires CLI credentials to login and use the app.
- If connecting to a remote (not local) appliance through the app, ensure SSH (port 22) is open to the appliance.

This Integration queries the ThreatMiner API to extract additional information from artifacts associated with an incident.

More information can be found here for *[ThreatMiner](https://www.threatminer.org/api.php)*

**Functions**
* Domain Whois
* Domain Subdomains
* Email Reverse
* IP Whois
* Samples Metadata

Sample workflows and rules are provide demonstrating execution with the results returned in an incident note.

en.extension_short_description: Exabeam is a user behavior analytics solution to quickly detect modern cyber attacks.
en.extension_long_description: Exabeam is a user behavior analytics solution that leverages existing log data to quickly detect modern cyber attacks, prioritize security incidents, and accelerate effective response. Unique among UBA products, Exabeam creates a complete timeline of every event and anomaly tied to an attack and uses that timeline to assess risk and automate many tasks of incident response. As a result, Exabeam not only improves security, but also transforms SOC efficiency and productivity. Exabeam App for QRadar provides a single console for user behaviors and risk scores that is integrated with existing security operations workflows.

2.27.301: Multiple Watchlists: Exabeam supports multiple Watchlists on the homepage. These can be out-of-the-box Watchlists populated by Exabeam or custom Watchlists created by the Analysts.
Saved Searches: Using Exabeam Threat Hunter, analysts can now save all of the search parameters of any search.
IP-Asset Associations: Exabeam keeps track of asset-to-IP associations over time. This allows analysts to search for assets that had a specific IP at any point in time.
Ransomware Detection: Exabeam can track ransomware anywhere in the enterprise environment, including hybrid clouds and devices where agents can't be installed.
Flight Risk or Leavers Detection: Exabeam monitors environments for those behaviorÂ changes by analyzing proxy logs.

en.extension_short_description: Creates Events, Attributes and Sightings in MISP from incidents and artifacts in Resilient
en.extension_long_description:
The purpose of this package is to allow the creation of an event in MISP from an incident in Resilient. This could represent a multiple-to-one or a one-to-one relationship. Once the event is created, attributes can be populated to it. 

For artifacts which have a hit in MISP, one can create a sighting back to MISP to show threat intelligence teams the indicator has been seen in the wild. 

Additional search functions allow one to search all attributes and return sightings from an event.

This package does not replace or supersede the MISP Custom Threat Service, the aim is to supplement it and create a bi-directional connection and integration. 

The package is built in a flexible way so it can be used with any real rule or workflow configuration. Sample rules and workflows are provided.

Custom attribute types can be mapped from the workflow pre-processing script of the function. See the sample workflows for sample payloads returned.

en.extension_short_description: Protect your company from device, network and application-based mobile threats.
en.extension_long_description:
Zimperium is a global leader in mobile security, offering real-time, on-device protection against both known and unknown Android and iOS threats. The Zimperium platform leverages a machine learning-based engine, z9, to protect mobile data, apps and sessions against device compromises, network attacks and malicious apps. en.extension_short_description: Helping you to manage your apps inventory and resources for QRadar.
en.extension_long_description:
The QRadar Assistant app helps you manage your app and content extension inventory, view app and content extension recommendations, follow the QRadar Twitter feed, and get links to useful QRadar information. 

**Key Features** 

**Guide Center**  
The QRadar Assistant Guide Center is a central point that links you to a wide collection of QRadar information resources. From the Guide Center, you can view tuning and use cases videos that are recorded by QRadar experts, watch previously recorded open mic sessions, and access a wide variety of QRadar technical tips.  

**Featured Applications**  
Featured applications showcase 4 of the most recently recommended QRadar applications featured on IBM App Exchange.  


**Twitter and Support**  
View live feeds from @AskIBMSecurity and the latest QRadar related questions from IBM developerWorks forums.  

**Applications**  
Search, sort, and filter available apps by various categories. You can see a quick view of the app, then expand to see the full description. You can download new and update up to five existing apps directly from within the Assistant at any one time.

**Watson Readiness**  
Run an evaluation to check if your QRadar system is Watson ready. If your system is Watson ready, you can sign-up for an QRadar Advisor for Watson trial from the Assistant.

In the Guide Center, added the IBM Learning Academy section that provides video tutorials.
Under the social networking section in the Guide Center, added the IBM Security Community sub-section.
In the Applications, added a new section (Installed) that lists currently installed QRadar extensions and contents.
2.4.0: Added a link to the QRadar documentation on the IBM Knowledge Center.

en.extension_short_description: Find and contain endpoints fast with SentinelOne
en.extension_long_description:
This function allows the query of SentinelOne, an endpoint technology for common security tasks.

It is a lightweight integration, due to SentinelOne's extensive API, adding further capability would be trivial.

Currently the functionality is as follows:

+ Lookup endpoint details from IP, Hostname etc
+ Disconnect endpoint from the network
+ Reconnect endpoint to the network
+ Add file hash to Black List

en.extension_name: IBM Security Access Manager Dynatrace Extension
en.extension_short_description: This extension can be used to install a Dynatrace agent into the ISAM appliance for monitoring of the runtime profile.
en.extension_long_description: Dynatrace AppMon (https://www.dynatrace.com/support/doc/appmon/) is an application monitoring tool that provides performance metrics in real time.   This extension will install an agent into the IBM Security Access Manager appliance so that the AppMon software can be used to monitor the Advanced Access Control/Federation runtime.  This extension currently requires the following version of the Dynatrace AppMon agent: 7.0.0.2469

1.1.4: It is now possible to add a user menu option to manually create sightings from incident artifacts.
In the artifact detail view, connected entities are listed individually instead of being reported together in the same line.
If the reported connected entities are tagged in the platform, the corresponding tag details are included in round brackets, after the entity names.

en.extension_short_description: Integration provides support for EclecticIQ Threat Intelligence Platform software as a Custom Threat  Service component.
en.extension_long_description: This integration provides support of EclecticIQ Threat Intelligence Platform software as Custom Threat Service component in IBM Resilient. Provides ability to lookup artifacts in EclecticIQ Platform from Resilient to aid determining and resolving malicious activity. Also there are abilities to create sightings into EclecticIQ Platform from Resilient through custom action.

en.extension_short_description: Detects advanced threats at windows endpoints using sysmon logs.
en.extension_name: IBM QRadar Content Extension for Sysmon

1.1.1: Removed 2 AQL functions and rules due to possible performance issue.
1.1.0: -Added several new rules, including those to detect:
-Privilege Escalation
-Fileless UAC bypass
-Credential Dumping
-Lateral Movement techniques using Powershell, PsExec, or a scheduling a task over Multiple Hosts
-Metasploit PsExec implementation
-Process Baselining to detect anomalous/unusual/malicious processes
-More Powershell malicious usages
-Added new custom properties, saved searches and reference data collections.
-Added two new AQL custom function.
-Added a new icon in the admin tab to configure an authorized token for Sysmon custom functions.
1.1.2:
Updated the custom properties based on the new Sysmon log format.
updated some existing rules and saved searches, and enhanced the baselining rules
1.0.1: Fixed nesting for iexplorer.exe in ProcessMaptoProcessPath map of maps

en.extension_long_description:
Sysmon is a Windows system service and device driver that monitors system activity and logs events in the Windows event log.  

Sysmon is free, easy to install, and it provides more detailed information than the Windows security logs. QRadar uses the forwarded logs to detect advanced threats on Windows endpoints.  

This content pack provides many use cases to detect advanced threats, such as PowerShell abuse, hidden Windows processes, 'fileless' memory attacks, code obfuscation, and many more.  

This content pack includes new offenses rules, building blocks, reference sets, and custom functions that enhance detection capabilities.  

**Note: Update the Microsoft Windows DSM to the latest version, manually or by using Auto Update, before you install IBM QRadar Sysmon Content Extension.**

en.extension_short_description: Ensure your enterprise is secured and gain insight into important security related events originating from IBM Z.
en.extension_long_description: Z Audit provides insight into important security related events originating from IBM Z. By tracking and analyzing critical system events that interact with sensitive data, Z Audit helps ensure that your enterprise is securely configured to help minimize threats and prevent potential security breaches. Custom tailored dashboards help identify and collect detailed information necessary for ensuring compliance with various security regulations and audit mandates.

additional_doc.name: Z Audit Quick Start Guide V1.0.0.pdf

en.extension_short_description: Integrate King and Union's Avalon with Resilient
en.extension_long_description: This extension connects IBM Resilient to King and Union's Avalon Threat Intelligence platform. Workspaces in Avalon can be created and auto-populated with incident artifacts from Resilient, and the results of the investigation from Avalon can be automatically re-populated into the connected Resilient incident. Avalon is a real-time collaborative Threat Intelligence platform that helps analysts better understand threat intelligence data and automates many of the repetitive tasks of gathering information.

en.extension_short_description: Threat Service to lookup artifacts in a YETI threat intelligence repository
en.extension_long_description: This threat lookup integration automatically searches a [YETI](https://yeti-platform.github.io/) repository when artifacts are tracked within the Resilient platform, alerting the incident response team if YETI has information related to these observables, indicators of compromise, TTPs, and other threat information.

additional_doc.name: IBM Security QRadar Network Protection Connector User Guide.pdf

en.extension_long_description: IBM QRadar Network Protection Connector enables IBM QRadar users to create custom rules that identify and classify network assets, and automatically save those asset references as a network object on IBM Security Network Protection (XGS), a next-generation intrusion prevention system.  IBM XGS administrators may then apply network access policies (NAP) to the network objects to protect critical systems and services.
en.extension_short_description: Uses QRadar asset information to enable active network protection on IBM XGS.
IBM QRadar AQL Codec Functions
en.extension_name: IBM QRadar AQL Codec Functions Content Extension
en.extension_long_description: The IBM QRadar AQL Codec Functions Content Extension allows you to encode and decode URLs as well as text to and from Base 64.

1.0.1: Updated manifest.
You must remove version 1.0.0 before adding a newer version or the system will display two versions.

en.extension_long_description:
This package contains functions that integrate with Ansible to run playbooks and modules for remote host execution.

Features:

- Run pre-written Ansible Playbooks from the Resilient platform, using parameter substitution.
- Run Ansible Modules for ad-hoc command execution.
- Run Resilient Rules at the Incident and Artifact levels.

Additional documentation on Ansible can be found at [the Ansible website](https://docs.ansible.com/).
en.extension_short_description: Run Ansible Playbooks as part of your enterprise cybersecurity analysis and protection

additional_doc.name: The CounterTack Sentinel App for QRadar.pdf

en.extension_short_description: The CounterTack App allows users to easily correlate with and act upon data from QRadar log sources.
en.extension_long_description: The CounterTack Sentinel App for QRadar delivers unprecedented endpoint detection and response (EDR) capabilities to correlate endpoint data from any QRadar log source and respond to threats accordingly. Operators can view summary or detailed behavioral data through dashboards, and pivot into the Sentinel console. Other capabilities: Sentinel cluster status, easy sensor download, and endpoint quarantine with a single click from within the QRadar interface. Requires CounterTack Sentinel cluster.

1.0.2: Updated documentation.
Added a selftest capability, to enable users to test their Elasticsearch connection before starting the integration server.
1.0.3: Bugfix http

en.extension_short_description: Workflow functions that allow users of the Resilient Platform to connect to and query an ElasticSearch Database.
en.extension_long_description: Workflow functions that allow users of the Resilient Platform to connect to and query an ElasticSearch Database.

en.extension_short_description: Leverage the power of ThreatStream enriched threat intel and investigations from within IBM Resilient

2.1.0: Support for ThreatStream OnPrem and ThreatStream Airgap
Import artifacts into ThreatStream as observables, to conduct further analysis upon or for use in investigations
Create or update ThreatStream investigations with the data and artifacts contained within a Resilient security incident, with the click of a button
Define any number of custom ThreatStream tags to automatically be added to ThreatStream observable import jobs and investigations created by the integration
Support for Resilient v32
2.0.1: ThreatStream Custom Threat Service extracted out to it's own package
Only indicators currently marked as active by ThreatStream will be returned as artifact hits, reducing false positives

en.extension_long_description:
This is a bi-directional integration between Anomali ThreatStream and IBM Resilient, enhancing the capabilities of both products and allowing security teams to work as efficiently as possible. The integrations features are as follows;

- Artifacts attached to Resilient security incidents can be enriched with actionable threat intelligence data from ThreatStream, such as severity, confidence score and geolocation information along with a drilldown link to ThreatStream for further analysis.

- Import one or many artifacts from a Resilient security incident into ThreatStream as observables, enabling you to the leverage the power of ThreatStream's correlative and analytical capabilities to perform in depth investigations into the nature of these artifacts and gain additional context around them.

- Create or update ThreatStream investigations from the data and artifacts contained within a Resilient security incident, with the click of a button. Effectively allowing your Resilient security team to raise a ThreatStream investigation and then continuously push updates to it and attach additional observables without ever having to leave the Resilient user interface.

- Ability to define any number of custom ThreatStream tags that will automatically be added to ThreatStream observable import jobs or investigations created by the integration, allowing you to easily add organization specific context around these items.

en.extension_short_description: Use IPVOIDs vast range of IP address tools to discover more details about IP addresses from IBM Resilient
en.extension_long_description:
**This package contains a Function that integrates with your IPVOID account using their APIs**

* Integrates with IPVOID's vast range of IP Address tools to discover details about IP address helping you get enriched information about a Resilient Artifact

* This package supports the following queries and actions:
  * IP Reputation
  * SSL Info
  * Threat Log Review
  * Email Verification
  * DNS Lookup
  * Domain Blacklist


Responses are appended to an artifact's description field.

en.extension_name: AlienVault OTX Function for IBM Resilient
en.extension_short_description: Enhance responses with AlientVault OTX Threat Intelligence Information
en.extension_long_description:
**This package contains a Resilient function that allows you to search your AlienVault OTX Platform with a given query for threat intelligence data about a particular threat indicator**

* Threat intelligence indicators can be searched by: 
  * IP Address
  * Domain
  * Host Name
  * File Hashes
  * URL
  * CVE

* The function makes use of the AlienVault OTX _api/v1/indicators_ API call to get information on a given query

* More information on [Alien Vault OTX ](https://otx.alienvault.com/api)

en.extension_name: IBM Security Access Manager Extension for Glowroot
en.extension_short_description: This extension will add the Glowroot agent to the appliance. Glowroot is an Open source Java APM tool.
en.extension_long_description:
Glowroot is an open source application performance management tool. 

It helps to detect and diagnose complex application performance problems to maintain an expected level of service. It will help you to isolate the reason behind slow requests , and you will be able to determine the time that it takes to complete each user action, and also trace SQL capture and aggregation statistics 
The following Glowroot agent versions are currently supported: 
- v0.13.5
- v0.13.4
- v0.13.3
- v0.13.2

The Agent file which is required by the extension can be downloaded at [https://github.com/glowroot/glowroot/releases/](https://github.com/glowroot/glowroot/releases/)

en.extension_short_description: GoVerifyID provides mobile biometric user authentication with turnkey integration for ISAM.
en.extension_long_description:
GoVerifyID provides end-to-end, enterprise-ready, mobile biometric user authentication for IBM Security Access Manager (ISAM).

For the enterprise, GoVerifyID is an ultra-scalable, multi-modal biometric Software-as-a-Service. It’s easy to install into your existing ISAM system with no upfront cost and no disruption to your business.   

To the end user, GoVerifyID is an easy to use mobile app that’s downloaded from Apple’s App Store or Google's Play Store. Authentication is as simple as taking a selfie, speaking a passphrase or swiping a finger. 

ImageWare's highly scalable biometric engine can process hundreds of millions of transactions.  Patented anonymous cloud storage ensures user privacy and security.

en.extension_short_description: DSM for audit events generated by Keeper service.
en.extension_long_description:
Keeper Security is a cybersecurity platform for preventing password-related data breaches and cyberthreats. It includes Advanced Reporting and Audit Module, which allows enterprises to track security related activity within their Keeper application.

Keeper can be set up to push the audit events into QRadar via syslog compatible Log Source.

This content pack provides Keeper event parsing and categorization for QRadar. Learn more at [Keeper Documentation Portal](https://docs.keeper.io/enterprise-guide/event-reporting#external-logging).

en.extension_short_description: ReversingLabs TitaniumCloud XREF integration provides historic AV vendor cross-reference data for IBM Resilient.
en.extension_name: ReversingLabs TitaniumCloud XREF Function Integration for Resilient
en.extension_long_description:
- ReversingLabs TitaniumCloud XREF Function integration provides options to automate file sample and hash value query responses within the IBM Resilient platform according to ReversingLabs Historic Multi-AV Scan Records information.
- With this extension the IBM Resilient platform gains the option to incorporate querying the ReversingLabs TitaniumCloud XREF (Historic Multi-AV Scan Records) API as a function when creating Workflows.
- Results from the ReversingLabs TitaniumCloud XREF API enrich the Resilient Workflows with multiple anti-virus scanner file status reports in the ReversingLabs TitaniumCloud.

This function incorporates APIs available from [URLhaus](https://urlhaus.abuse.ch/) to enrich data on:

* urls
* domains
* IP Addresses
* MD5 and SHA-256 Hashes
* tags (ex. Troldesh)

It also includes the capability to submit a url as distributing malware to a public searchable database.

This package include 2 functions, 2 workflows and 2 example rules.
en.extension_short_description: Integration with URLhaus for artifact enrichment and submission on confirm malicious URLs
Integration between IBM QRadar and ThreatConnect.

1.1.0: Added proxy support.

en.extension_long_description:
With this integration, you can aggregate your logs from IBM QRadar and combine them with your threat intelligence in ThreatConnect. The platform provides context with the indicators, and enables your security team to easily spot abnormal trends and patterns, and to act on them efficiently.

The ThreatConnect app for QRadar enables:
  • Instant indicator enrichment: Hover over an indicator in QRadar to see a real-time summary of what ThreatConnect knows about that indicator.
  • Actionable threat intel: Look up and create indicators or report false positives to ThreatConnect from within QRadar.
  • Easy install: Built on the QRadar GUI app framework, this integration can be installed directly from within the IBM Security App Exchange.

additional_doc.name: Digital Guardian QRadar Application - Product Guide(1).pdf

en.extension_short_description: This app allows customers to leverage Digital Guardian's deep endpoint visibility and response.
en.extension_name: Digital Guardian App for IBM QRadar
en.extension_long_description: The Digital Guardian (DG) App for IBM QRadar allows QRadar customers to leverage Digital Guardian's deep visibility of insider threats and advanced external attacks on the endpoint in QRadar and then respond to these threats by deploying endpoint controls including endpoint quarantine. The App features filterable dashboards of Data Loss Prevention (DLP) and Advanced Threat Prevention (ATP) events from endpoint computers which include visibility of egress of sensitive data.

en.extension_short_description: Mimecast for IBM QRadar integrates email and audit security data into IBM’s security intelligence platform.
en.extension_long_description:
The Mimecast integration with IBM QRadar offers joint customers improved visibility into potential vulnerabilities, ongoing attacks, prioritized incident response alerts and an overall increased security posture through one single console.
 
With email remaining the number one attack vector, it’s more important than ever to bring email security data into a single platform. The Mimecast for IBM QRadar app offers organizations better detection and alerting before, during and after an attack. Integrating Mimecast data into the IBM QRadar security intelligence platform through the Mimecast data logging API allows email security data to be correlated against other data sources, and be included in behavioral anomaly detection helping to identify indicators of advanced threats in real-time, that would otherwise go unnoticed.
 
Mimecast and IBM customers can better predict and prioritize what vulnerabilities to remediate through improved visibility of attacks with highly focused alerts. These alerts allow security teams to respond faster and with more certainty which helps contain and limit the impact of an attack. Additionally, joint customers can benefit from an increased security posture by leveraging one single system for threat intelligence and response.

1.0.5: Improved parser to handle the presence of special characters within the 'subject' field.

Support for distributed QRadar environments. Admins can specify the IP address of the target event 
collector/processor on the Mimecast for QRadar App configuration page
Improved OpenSSL key generation
Mimecast Saved Searches have been assigned to a group
Resolved a high resource consumption issue, where supervisord.log references as 'Too many open files'
Updated minimum QRadar version to 7.3.1

en.extension_long_description:
Use the QRadar Operations app to quickly view user activities and assess their impact on the overall system. The Operations app collects information from all relevant sources within the system and provides a single view of user configuration changes to help administrators easily troubleshoot and investigate the cause of certain behaviors in the system.

The user interface is fully interactive. Throughout the app, you can click multiple data points to view the changes that users make on the system, or click any of the graphs to view the data that exists during a specific time frame.

en.extension_short_description: Enables threat hunting and thorough incident response with domain name profiles & risk scores.
en.extension_name: DomainTools Iris App for IBM QRadar
en.extension_long_description:
The *[DomainTools Iris Enrich App](https://www.domaintools.com/products/integrations/ibm-security)* for QRadar helps security teams uncover advanced threats associated with network events from their environment. The DomainTools App brings the context of domain profiles and risk scores intelligence for every Internet domain name inside of your QRadar platform.

**Key capabilities** enabled by the app include:
- DomainTools Threat Hunting Dashboard in QRadar presents a dynamic view of threats associated with observed domains in the user's environment.
- Create offenses using DomainTools proprietary domain risk scores
- Investigate domain names in-context, without leaving IBM QRadar
- Target threat hunting at key aspects of a domain name registration profile

Our users quickly gain situational awareness with actor-centric dashboard panels, focused on domain name registration profiles and informed by DomainTools risk scores. These data points offer overall insights into domain names your organization interacts with on a daily basis. They also guide security teams to write precisely-targeted event searches and offense rules within Qradar.

Event decoration is a proven practice in leading security operation centers. The DomainTools Iris App for QRadar brings *[Iris investigation capabilities](https://www.domaintools.com/products/iris/)* to every organization that has domain names in any of your QRadar log sources, e.g. in web-proxy and DNS logs. When properly enriched, those logs become powerful tools to find lateral movement, proactively alert on actor identity and infrastructure, and comprehensively triage security incidents. 

The DomainTools app also adds in-context domain investigation functionality to IBM QRadar. Incident responders and SOC analysts can quickly triage a domain name by viewing its domain profile, Whois data and risk score, and they can perform essential pivots to find related domain names likely controlled by the same actor. 

The app leverages the latest *[DomainTools Iris Enrich API](https://www.domaintools.com/resources/api-documentation/iris-enrich/)* for all enrichment inside of IBM QRadar.

1.0.480: Offers custom AQL function to extract registered domains from hostnames
Populates reference set with high-risk domains for easier rule matching
Uses log source types for faster configuration

en.extension_short_description: Anti-spoofing cyber-Security solution for Bank and Corporate on IBM Cloud & Premises integrated with IBM-ISAM.
en.extension_long_description:
United Biometrics’ solution reinforces the IBM security portfolio by highly securing 3 components of the IBM security ecosystem:

  1. Securing Mobile Devices – biometric authentication for transaction protection, and content security.
  2. Securing Identiy and Access – biometric authentication for access management, central monitoring of authenticated users on corporate servers.
  3. Preventing Advanced Fraud – fraud protection, criminal detection.

United Biometrics’ solutions are based on the use of a mobile terminal - smartphone, tablet - a PC and/or a smart card whose holder is authenticated through a control carried out by means of biometric sensors embedded on such terminals (fingerprint sensor, camera, microphone), in a real time transaction process.

  • Dual Authenticator suite is available on IBM Cloud and integrated into an IBM product line ISAM for mobile users (smartphone & tablet) – it features two or more biometric and behavioural factors for authentication.
  • Single Sign-On Authenticator is the product available for desktop users - it features a biometric dynamic authentication on key strokes.
United Biometrics’ solution is available on all operating systems and all mobile devices.

Double-step authentication process for more security: authentication on device and authentication on server simultaneously in real-time.

Anonymous authentication with data desensitization: all data are stored in a desensitized format, preventing to reverse engineering biometric information.

A key differentiator of United Biometrics’ solutions is that biometric data is stored anonymously. With this highly secure process, when hackers break the database, they will not be able to reconcile the stolen biometric information with individuals and re-use desensitized data for their criminal benefit.

United Biometrics’ solutions are compliant with European Directives PSD2 which requires at least 2 strong authentication factors (2FA), and GDPR (General Data Protection Regulation).

license.name: VF 220618 Agreement for Evaluation of United Biometrics SaaS Offering.pdf

en.extension_short_description:
2-factor authentication on mobile phones and pc's.
Simple, secure and cost effective!
en.extension_long_description:
Forget about code generator fobs and expensive SMS based authentication solutions. Buypass Code is a mobile phone application for 2-factor authentication - supplied as a service

Let your employees use their mobile phones to gain secure access to your company‘s systems via VPN and web.

  • Users download the Buypass Code app to their mobile phone and set up a 4-digit PIN code
  • Day-to-day use: Authenticate using a user name and one-time code generated by the Buypass Code app
  • Invoicing is based on active users not on the number of licences or authentications
  • Buypass manages server administration and operation, relieving your company of software and hardware implementation and updating
  • Uses the companys user database in ISAM, administered via a web interface
  • Supports all types of mobile phones
  • Buypass Code Manager - administration via a web based administration system


What does it cost to use the solution?

  • Free app for downloading
  • Monthly fixed price per user - not based on the number of authentications
  • Free use of Buypass Code Manager

Technical specifications

Platforms:
 iPhone, iPad, iPod, Symbian, Android phones, Android e-book readers, Windows Phone 7 and 8, Java phones.

en.extension_short_description: Analyze files using SNDBOX cloud sandbox service
en.extension_long_description:
Developed by researchers for researchers, SNDBOX is the first malware research solution to leverage multiple AI detection vectors and undetectable kernel driver analysis. 
Working together, SNDBOX technology delivers in depth results, quickly while granting the AI and big data insights necessary for comprehensive malware research and false positive rate reduction. 

Do more with SNDBOX.

en.extension_short_description: Consolidate security monitoring, logging, reporting and event analysis into a single console.
en.extension_long_description: Security devices generate large amounts of data that can make analysis difficult. The Check Point SmartView Application for QRadar consolidates monitoring, logging, reporting and event analysis into a single console to bring you comprehensive, easy-to-understand threat visibility. Enable your security team to focus their efforts on the critical threats by delivering network and security events from Check Point devices to QRadar for forensic analysis within a unified console.

en.extension_short_description: This app displays the Guardium distributed environment's utilization and health dashboards. It is recommended to install
en.extension_long_description: This app displays the Guardium distributed environment's utilization and health dashboards. It is recommended to install on a central manager unit. It displays the utilization distribution, activity trend, aggregation heatmap, scheduled jobs, etc for each unit of the distributed environment. For users to have a dashboard view of each unit's utilization, schedule, capacity.

en.extension_short_description: Functions to search IBM X-Force for artifact enrichment.
en.extension_long_description:
IBM X-Force Exchange is a threat intelligence sharing platform enabling research on security threats, aggregation of intelligence, and collaboration with peers.

These functions allow users to search X-Force Exchange Collections for enrichment information about a threat. Users may search all collections using an IP Address, File Hash, DNS Record or provide a query which will return a number of collections. Users can also get a specific collection by its identifier which will return information about the requested collection to the Resilient Platform for use in other functions.

en.extension_short_description: Additional rule and report content focusing on GDPR compliance and policy controls.
en.extension_name: IBM QRadar Content Extension for GDPR
en.extension_long_description:
The GDPR content pack provides rules and reports content to implementsÂ GDPR 2016/679 controls. The GDPR content pack includes IBM custom properties as placeholders, which are meant to be replaced by specific Log Sources Properties. You can download other content extensions that include custom properties with these names, or you can create your own. See the documentation for more information on related content packs. The use cases covered in this content pack are: 1. Data Exfiltration Detected from GDPR Personal Data Server 1. Large Outbound Transfer 1. Personal Data Processed for Objected Users 1. Personal Data Transferred to Third Countries/Regions 1. Possible Shared Accounts 1. Remote Connection on GDPR Personal Data Server 1. Remote Inbound Communication from a Foreign Country/Region The content pack also contains reporting on the following: 1. Personal Data Origin 1. Data Retention 1. Processing Activities 1. User Authentication to GDPR Personal Data Server 1. Personal Data Transferred to a Third Country 1. QRadar User and Role Modifications 1. QRadar Authentication The IBM QRadar Content Extension for GDPR can be used with: - Data obfuscation - QRadar Network Insights

Code to include the Pulse dashboard, shown below, is available on IBM Security Community.

1.0.1: GDPR Reports
1.0.2: Removed rule 'Load Basic Building Blocks' from the package. Please install 'Baseline Maintenance' version 1.0.9 and up.
Custom properties that were previously linked to the SIM Generic Log DSM log source type are linked to the IBM Custom DSM log source type.

en.extension_short_description: Threat Service to lookup artifacts in AbuseIPDB
en.extension_long_description: This threat lookup integration automatically checks [AbuseIPDB](https://www.abuseipdb.com/) when IP address artifacts are tracked within the Resilient platform, alerting the incident response team if anyone else has reported malicious activities.

en.extension_long_description: Allows users to manage ERP security events detected by Onapsis Security Platform (OSP) detection engine alongside other security events. Alarms configured in OSP will be forwarded to QRadar.

en.extension_name: gRPC Interface Functions for IBM Resilient
en.extension_short_description: A general purpose wrapper that allows one to call gRPC services from within IBM Resilient
en.extension_long_description:
This Function provides a general purpose wrapper that allows you to call gRPC services from within IBM Resilient.

Using gRPC you can efficiently connect services in and across data centers to help with your Incident Response.

* This version supports **Unary RPCs** where the client sends a single request to the server and gets a single response back, just like a normal function call.

* See [https://grpc.io/](https://grpc.io/) for more information on gRPC.

* We recommend following the gRPC *helloworld example* [here](https://grpc.io/docs/quickstart/python.html) to help get this Integration up and running.

**Requirements**
- IBM Resilient Appliance>=v31.0.0
- Integrations Server running resilient-circuits>=v31.0.0
- A knowledge of Remote Procedure Calls (RPCs) and [gRPC](https://grpc.io/)

en.extension_long_description:
IBM Verify Gateway for RADIUS component includes a RADIUS interface where VPNs and other RADIUS clients can request authentication making use of the multi-factor authentication mechanisms from the Cloud.

Version 1.0.0.1 includes a new use-local-pwd-check config option.

en.extension_long_description:
Use the IBM QRadar Tuning app to fine-tune your IBM QRadar deployment. Tune your offenses by going through the most common configuration steps or by analyzing rules that cause the biggest number of offenses.

Capabilities include:

- Tuning the most active rules: The QRadar Tuning app can help you determine which rules generate the most offenses, and then guide you through the steps to tune them.
- Tuning based on the CRE event report: The Custom Rules Engine (CRE) event report shows which CRE events were generated most often. It also provides information about the rule activity. You can tune these rules or use the event information from the report to update your QRadar environment.
- Reviewing network hierarchy: Network hierarchy is used to define which IP addresses and subnets are part of your network. Defining your network hierarchy and keeping it up-to-date is an important step in helping prevent false positives.
- Reviewing common server building blocks: Rules use information about your servers to determine whether to generate the rule responses. Review and update common rule building blocks to enable QRadar to discover and classify more servers on your network, and prevent false positives.

If you use QRadar V7.3.1, you'll need to run a script on the QRadar Console to generate a rules data file and then upload it to the app. There is also a utility to make the rule export from QRadar easier for admins. For more information about the utility, see [How to import rules to the QRadar Tuning App (XML format)](https://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=ibm10875162). This step is not required for QRadar V7.3.2 or later.

QRadar Tuning V1.1.0+ is also supported on QRadar on Cloud.

en.extension_long_description:
Cisco Umbrella Investigate is a comprehensive solution that maintains a collection of data sources which can be queried for DNS related security events and correlation data. This integration package, based on the Resilient functions feature, allows for the enrichment of Resilient data using the results returned from the Cisco Umbrella Investigate REST API.

This integration performs the following operations:
* Get Classifiers for a domain
* Get DNS RR history for a domain or IP address
* Get Co-Occurrences for a domain
* Get Related Domains for a domain
* Get Security Information for a domain
* Get Domain Status and Categorizations
* Get Domain Volume
* Get WHOIS information for a domain, name server or email address
* Get ASN information for an IP address or AS number
* Get Latest Malicious Domains for an IP address
* Do a regular expression pattern search
* Get Threat Grid sample for a hash (md5, sha1 or sha256)
* Get Threat Grid sample for a domain, IP address or a URL
* Get Timeline for a domain

The remainder of this document describes each included function, how to configure them in custom workflows, and any additional customization options.

en.extension_short_description: This package contains common utility and helper routines to facilitate the development of functions for IBM Resilient.
en.extension_long_description:
This package contains common utility and helper routines to facilitate the development of functions for IBM Resilient. It reduces the code and complexity for frequent data processing steps.

Modules in this package include:

* function_results - A class to standardize on the payload returned from functions. In addition to integration results returned, meta-data about the integration execution environment is returned.

* function_metrics - A class to collect metrics information to be added to the resulting json payload.

* html2markdown - A class to convert html code to markdown. Parameters exist to customize the conversion to the type of markdown output required.
* integration_errors - Contains a simple exception for function failures: IntegrationError
* requests_common - A class of common code for making REST API calls with logic for proxies and standard return code handling.
* resilient_common - Common code for interacting with Resilient. Functions include:

   - build_incident_url - Build a URL back to the issuing incident for 3rd party software reference.
   - build_resilient_url - Build a URL to access resilient. Useful for API calls.
clean_html - Remove html code from rich text fields. Data is concatenated together. Use html2markdown for better results.
   - unescape - Restore data which has been encoded for URL transmission (ex. > = >).
   - validate_fields - Ensure require fields from Resilient or the app.config file are present.
   - get_file_attachment - Return a byte string of a Resilient attachment related to an incident, task or artifact.
   - get_file_attachment_name - Return the name of an attachment
   - readable_datetime - Convert epoch formatted data and time value into a string.
   - str_to_bool - Convert string values into boolean.

The integration of PRADEO SECURITY Mobile Threat Defense technology within IBM MaaS360 combines real-time analysis and machine learning to efficiently protect mobile devices directly from MaaS360. 
PRADEO SECURITY is an automated solution that auto-adapts to its environment to provide fast, appropriate and proactive threat management. 
It protects Apps, Networks and Devices layers from known, unknown and advanced threats.
Pradeo’s patented technology performs static and dynamic analysis and correlates the data it obtains to precisely identify and qualify all mobile applications’ behaviors and suspicious activities on mobile devices. It is the only solution providing an accurate detection, outperforming score-based technologies. Threats are automatically blocked according to the security policy. The alliance of real-time scanning, correlation and automation enables a full protection against all kinds of attacks.
This app allows to simplify the integration between MaaS360 and Pradeo security platforms.

en.extension_long_description:
The Fortinet FortiGate App for QRadar has been designed to improve the capabilities and user experience for IBM QRadar users within environments using Fortinet FortiGate solutions. The app provides additional visibility into FortiGate logs in the QRadar Ariel DB including traffic, threats and system logs through a series of tabs and dashboards from within the QRadar GUI. The app displays top contributors to threats and traffic based on variables including service, user, IP address and subtypes e.g. Web Filter, Anti-Virus, IPS and Application Control. The app also displays performance statistics for the FortiGate system including Wireless Access Points and VPN events. QRadar users can drill down into each view to show the relevant logs by clicking on the charts, with the ability to select different time ranges up to the last 30 days.
The app includes 35 customized properties, some of which were already available in Fortinet QRadar Content Pack, however these have been defined/re-defined to better interpret FortiGate logs.

en.extension_short_description: Backup, import, export, and restore the QRadar Network Hierarchy using CSV files.
en.extension_long_description:
IBMÂŽ Security QRadarÂŽ uses the network hierarchy to understand your network traffic and provide you with the ability to view activity for your entire deployment. QRadar supports any network hierarchy that can be defined by a range of IP addresses. You can organize your network and systems on many different variables, including geographical or business units, role, or similar traffic patterns. QRadar considers all networks in the network hierarchy as local. Keep the network hierarchy up to date to prevent false offenses. Use this app to backup, import, export, and restore the QRadar network hierarchy using CSV files that are editable as spreadsheets.

Note: Before using this app, please read the following forum post http://ibm.biz/NetHierDefect which describes a defect in QRadar versions 7.2.8 and 7.3.0. Depending on how your network hierarchy is setup, this defect might change how your network hierarchy looks after using the app. This will not impact operation and usage of the network hierarchy.

Note: This app will not backup and restore the geolocation feature added to the Network Hierarchy in QRadar version 7.3.1.

This app is provided on an as-is basis. Please review the app documentation for additional support information.

1.0.1: The app now installs on QRadar versions below 7.2.8 patch 7 and 7.3.0 patch 2 if the console has no internet access.
Backups are now allowed even if your network hierarchy has non-ASCII characters.
The Backup Name special character check no longer allows special characters.

Take the pulse of your SOC with dynamic real-time dashboards that provide meaningful insights into your security posture and threat landscape. Visualize offenses, network data, threats, malicious user behavior, and cloud environments from around the world in geographical maps, a built-in 3D threat globe, and auto updating charts. Perfect for a quick overview of your current end-to-end security environment on a single display or on multi displays in your Security Operations Center. 

**Key capabilities:**
- Use predefined dashboards to get started before you create one of your own. 
- Import and export dashboards to share with colleagues.

- Fine-tune your display with complete flexibility in dashboard layout and dashboard item refresh rates.

- Create unique dashboards to track endpoint, user, cloud, department, and company-wide security and operational data. 
- Stay informed with single click drill-down to underlying event, network, and alert data. 
- Use parameters to easily reuse and update AQL elements in dashboard queries
- Assign thresholds to Big Number, Time Series, Tabular, and Geographical charts

**Note:** The new health metric dashboards are designed to work in QRadar V7.3.0 patch 6 or later. If you're currently using QRadar Pulse V1.1.0 on QRadar V7.2.8 or versions earlier than 7.3.0 patch 6, note that if you upgrade to QRadar Pulse V2.0.1 or later some dashboards and dashboard items might not render properly. Consider upgrading to QRadar V7.3.0 patch 6 or later.

en.extension_short_description: Function to check if IP Address & Domain Name type artifacts appear in a SpamHaus blocklist.
en.extension_long_description:
**Long Description:**    
 This integration allows a resilient user to submit an IP Address or Domain Name artifact to SpamHaus to check if it's found in a SpamHaus blocklist. If the artifact does appear in one of SpamHaus blocklists, Resilient will add detail information to the artifact's Description.    
 
**Key Features:**    
- Checks IP address artifact against SpamHaus blocklist   
 - Checks Domain Name artifact against SpamHaus blocklist   

**Requirement:**      
- IBM Resilient >= v31.0.0   
- An Integrations Server running resilient-circuits >= v31.0.0 with fn_spamhaus_query >= v1.0.0 installed

en.extension_short_description: Adds custom rules, reference sets, building blocks and saved searches for added detection of BadRabbit.
en.extension_long_description:
Out of the box QRadar will detect BadRabbit Ransomware as it moves laterally, exploits vulnerabilities and communicates with non-trusted internet sources. This content pack adds additional detection based on collaboratively developed threat intelligence for higher fidelity detection.

This content pack contains:
- 4 Reference sets
- 7 Building Blocks
- 1 Custom Rule
- 4 Event Saved Searches
- 2 Flow Saved Searches

The 4 reference sets for the BadRabbit Ransomware contain IP’s, Filenames, Hashes, HostNames for the BadRabbit Ransomware from the collection for X-Force https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/collection/XFTAS-SI-2017-00001-51701e9c25aaaf7e02b19fa6d63ccc80 (up-to-date as of 6pm BST, 25th October, 2017)

Note: The Building Blocks for IP's & URL's are not included by default as part of the offense rules due to possible false positives. Saved Searches have been included instead allowing users to run searches and investigate this way instead. Alternatively if you want to include these IOC's as part of offenses simply open the rules and add the IP and URL building blocks.

en.extension_short_description: The Resilient integration with Docker provides tools to integrate Docker into your Incident Response Plan.
en.extension_long_description:
This Integration provides the ability to use either existing well-known Docker images or to create your own, from which a Docker container will be created and started. Results are returned to Resilient both as a new attachment showing the logs and output as well as a payload of information related to the container.

This package contains 1 Function, 3 Workflows, 3 Rules and 1 Data Table that help you integrate with Docker

There are 3 referenced example Docker images and some use cases for these images provided with the package to give an outline for how you can use the Docker integration to work with your desired use case.
1. Volatility - An advanced memory analysis framework
2. NSRL - A large database of whitelisted MD5 hashes used to determine false positives
3. Amass - Used to do DNS exploration such as finding the subdomains of a given domain

The integration is not limited to images found on Dockerhub. Images which live on your private container registry can be used provided they are pulled to the machine you intend to run the integration from. Additionally, you may also choose to write your own Dockerfile to streamline any part of your overall SOAR plan, even if that is just reducing the time it takes to accomplish certain business tasks.

en.extension_name: Google Cloud DLP Functions for IBM Resilient
en.extension_short_description: Use Google DLP for identifying, redacting or de-identifying personally identifiable information (PII)
en.extension_long_description:
The Resilient Integration with Google Cloud DLP provides functions to integrate into your Incident Response Plan. The integration brings capabilities for either identifying, redacting or de-identifying personally identifiable information (PII) in a body of text.

Cloud DLP helps you better understand and manage sensitive data. It provides fast, scalable classification and redaction for sensitive data elements like credit card numbers, names, social security numbers, US and selected international identifier numbers, phone numbers, and GCP credentials. Cloud DLP classifies this data using more than 90 predefined detectors to identify patterns, formats, and checksums, and even understands contextual clues. You can optionally redact data as well, using techniques like masking, secure hashing, tokenization, bucketing, and format-preserving encryption. 

Key Features
* Inspect a text-based attachment for Personal Identifiable Information
* Search for and redact Personal Identifiable Information from an attachment or artifact
