en.extension_short_description: This is a QRadar App for Cisco Firepower.
en.extension_long_description:
Cisco Firepower System App for QRadar provides you with at-a-glance views of malware and intrusion events collected and generated by the system.
The panels provides key metrics on recent attacks, malware observed by frequency and machines that are believed to be compromised. The App provides 
data regarding Potential Indicators of Compromise, Indicators of Compromise by Host, Malware Threats, Intrusion Events, Host Receiving Malware and Host Sending Malware.
QRadar users can drill down into each chart to show the relevant data. Users can select a time window up to 168 hours.

**NOTE: This App (v1.1.0) must be installed on QRadar 7.3.1 Patch 7 or later**  

Run an effective Vulnerability Management program with insights delivered from the QRadar Vulnerability Insights (QVI) App.  
  
This App leverages the unique integrated view of all relevant security data available to the QRadar platform and delivers the insights you are looking for. It is able to identify from the available list of vulnerability instances, how many are patched, fixed, exploitable and exploited. Prioritizing the vulnerabilities that are critical to you is now just a click away. You can also drill into the specifics of this data from the same interface. This App also introduces new ways to visualize the Vulnerability Data in context with your environment.  

The Trending Vulnerabilities widget is an example of how you can monitor for vulnerabilities of interest. Advisory threat data for relevant malicious campaigns is imported dynamically from X-Force, and any current exposure info for these vulnerabilities is displayed.

The data populated in this App is derived from saved searches in QVM, therefore it is customizable, should you need to refine the definition of exploited, exploitable, patched, etc.  

The QVI App delivers all of this and more while integrating with several 3rd party scanners as well. Prioritize your remediation actions in just a few clicks!  

Additionally, QVI enables historical scan comparison. With a few clicks, you can generate a report comparing two runs of a scan to get valuable insights on vulnerability metrics over time. Note that the Compare Scans feature does not support scan data produced from 3rd party scanners - only scan data produced by the QVM Scanner itself can be compared.

1.1.0: Must be installed on QRadar 7.3.1 Patch 7 or later
We recommend that if your QRadar system is managing over 1 million active vulnerability instances, the data sync should be scheduled to be weekly instead of daily.
Historical scan comparison reporting.

en.extension_short_description: The QVI App provides the ability to view, interpret and drill into vulnerability and risk insights.
A network layer mobility solution for businesses that need security, visibility and control of their mobile data.
en.extension_long_description: Asavie Moda protects and controls mobile data and devices.  Because it is network layer solution, not an application, it is truly device and OS agnostic enabling businesses to easily secure and manage the data in transition for all SIM-enabled devices including smartphones, tablets, Wi-Fi hotspots, routers and dongles.  Moda protects sensitive personal and business data by blocking access to malicious apps and websites, making it a critical element in the implementation of a successful defence-in-depth strategy.  Through the visibility and control of the data transit, Asavie Moda can extend the policy for governance and compliance from MaaS360 to the mobile network.

en.extension_short_description: The Sentinelone Endpoint Extension for QRadar integrates SentinelOne detections and data, with automatic field mapping,
en.extension_long_description:
SentinelOne delivers the defenses you need to prevent, detect, and undo—known and unknown—threats.
The Sentinelone Endpoint Extension for QRadar enables integration of SentinelOne detections and data, with automatic field mapping, from the SentinelOne Management App to become actionable objects in QRadar.

**OpenVAS Vulnerability Assessment capabilities in QVM**

The open source project OpenVAS provides around 50,000 individual Network Vulnerability Tests (NVTs) through their Community Feed. These NVTs are individual tests that can assess a vulnerability. The QVM Engine for OpenVAS NVTs provides the ability to run these tests as part of a QVM Scan.

**Features**
- A new Scan Policy called "Full Scan Plus", separate from your existing scans. More vulnerability tests means extra time is required to run the scans. These scans will be using OpenVAS NVTs, as well as QVM's capabilities.
- Thousands of additional vulnerability tests.
- NVTs are updated nightly via existing Auto Updates. No extra configuration is required.
- No workflow change! All the vulnerabilities are raised through QVM.
- Optimized to not prevent authentication impact on assets (Brute Force).
- Optimized to prevent impact on QRadar hosts by running as a second-class citizen.

**Requirements**
- QRadar 7.3.1 Patch 3 or later is required, with QVM licensed.
- Install procedure will require console access as well as running Auto Updates. See the documentation provided with the download.

**FAQ**
- **Does the QVM Engine for OpenVAS NVT allow importing vulnerabilities into QVM from a standalone OpenVAS deployment?**
  No. This plugin enables QVM to run OpenVAS Network Vulnerability Tests as part of QVM scans but is not designed to provide integration with a separately provided instance of OpenVAS.
- **Does the Full Scan Plus run OpenVAS NVTs only?**
  No. The Full Scan Plus Policy uses a combination of QVM scanning tests with the NVTs for maximum coverage

en.extension_short_description: Easily select, index and display network metadata generated by the GigaSECURE Security Delivery Platform
en.extension_long_description:
Gigamon Metadata Application for IBM QRadar allows customers to extract, index and display network metadata generated by the GigaSECURE Security Delivery Platform. The application comes packaged with custom flow properties, saved searches and dashboards that would allow integration of Gigamon's Metadata offering with IBM QRadar. 

The GigaSECURE Security Delivery Platform allows users to extract and consolidate metadata from any monitored network traffic flows, package them into NetFlow IPFIX records, then send them QRadar SIEM for indexing and analysis. Gigamon has enriched the IPFIX records with information including URL information, HTTP/HTTPS return codes, and DNS query/response information, all of which provide the ability to rapidly diagnose security events for use cases such as, identifying rogue DNS services, spotting potential Command and Control server communications using high entropy domains and detecting use of non-trusted or self-signed certificates for SSL-decrypted traffic that could indicate nefarious activity.

en.extension_short_description: This app compares the discovered inspection engines (IEs) with the configured IEs and identifies missing STAP IEs
en.extension_long_description: Guardium discovery configures the inspection engines the first time the STAP agent is installed. After the installation, the discover runs on a scheduled basis (every 24 hours by default). Every time discovery runs, the identified instances are reported to the Guardium appliance. This report includes the instances identified as part of the initial installation as well as any new DB instances created after the agent is installed. There is no way to identify the new instances created and which instances do not have a corresponding Inspection Engine configured. This creates a gap for activity monitoring. This app compares the discovered inspection engines with the configured inspection engines and identifies any instances that do not have a matching inspection engine. The solution can be used to just create a report or automatically create an inspection engine for the instance that do not have an inspection engine configured.

en.extension_short_description: This extension allows you to maintain "replica" data for Resilient system data using near real-time synchronization.
en.extension_long_description:
This package contains the Data Feed extension.  This extension allows you to maintain "replica" data for a Resilient system.  The updates are performed in near real-time.

The use case for this extension is for situations where you want to run business intelligence (BI) queries from other tools.  It overcomes the need to query the Resilient database directly (which is normally inaccessible).

The data can be written to any or all of the following destinations:

- ODBC databases
  * PostgreSQL
  * MySQL (MariaDB)
  * Microsoft SQLServer
  * Oracle
- SQLite file/database
- Local directory (one file per object)
- ElasticSearch
- Splunk

Many BI tools can be used to run queries/reports against this data:

* Tableau
* Microsoft Power BI
* IBM Cognos
* Grafana

The IBM Security QRadar Log Source Management app is a new, completely redesigned interface for viewing, creating, editing and deleting log sources. Beyond the improved look-and-feel of the interface, the Log Source Management app provides:  

- Greatly enhanced filtering capabilities which make it much easier to find specific log sources of interest among thousands.  
- To save time, create, view, edit and delete log sources in bulk instead of one at a time.  
- A user-friendly wizard workflow for log source creation with descriptions of configuration parameters.
- In QRadar V7.3.2.3 or later, test your log source configuration to ensure that the parameters are correct.  
- The ability to view and edit log source details from the browse/list view without losing your current page or filter criteria.  
- Improved performance of the Log Source Management user interface, especially on systems with large numbers of log sources.  

Note that although the Log Source Management app will eventually replace the original "Log Sources" management interface, for now it is a separate QRadar application. After installing this app, the existing interface will still be usable and a user may choose which interface they wish to use to manage their log sources.  

This app is only functional on version 7.3.1 of QRadar or later. To use the app, you must have the Admin > System Administrator or Delegated Administration > Manage Log Sources capabilities assigned to your user role, in addition to a new "QRadar Log Source Management" capability which is added when the app is installed.  

Known issues for non-Admin users with the Delegated Administration>Manage Log Sources user role capability:  
1.  Log sources cannot be deleted with the app. They can still be deleted via the existing Log Sources UI.  
1.  When logging in to QRadar for the first time after a User Role has been changed by an admin user, it's possible that editing a log source with the app will fail to save. This can be resolved by logging out of QRadar and logging back in again. Editing log sources with the existing Log Sources UI is unaffected.

Visit the [IBM Security Learning Academy](https://www.securitylearningacademy.com/course/view.php?id=3559) for a course on how to use this app.

Asset management is a huge, nagging problem that is only getting worse. With the increase in the number and types of devices in today’s corporate environment, compounded by trends like BYOD, Cloud and IoT, it’s nearly impossible to understand how many devices are on our networks, what’s on them and whether they comply with the overall security policy. Until now.

Enter Axonius, a simple solution with a unique approach. By aggregating existing business data from over 100 management and security solutions, the Axonius Cybersecurity Asset Management Platform provides actionable visibility and automated security policy enforcement for every asset and user.

**Note:** This application requires a working Axonius instance as a prerequisite, as it is delivered entirely via a MaaS360 Adapter for Axonius. Instructions for how to set up this integration can be found in the PDF within the downloadable zip file, or at https://docs.axonius.com/v2/docs/ibm-maas360-with-watson. If you are not yet an Axonius customer and would like to see a demo, please fill out the form at https://www.axonius.com/demo/.

Understand relationships in your audit data by visualizing any Guardium report as a force-directed graph.
en.extension_long_description:
Understand relationships in your audit data by visualizing any Guardium report as a force-directed graph. Use cases include understanding data flows between databases and applications, visualizing entitlement hierarchies, and identifying communities of access around client IPs, source programs, and DB User Names.

This app allows you to select a Guardium report, pick a column to represent the "from" and "to" nodes, and then generate a force directed graph on the data. For example, to see how hosts in an environment interact with each other you could build a Guardium report showing Client IPs and Server IPs and run the access mapper on that report with Client IP selected as the "from" nodes and Server IP as the "to" nodes. Similarly, to see permission chains in database entitlements, you could run the "ORA Roles Granted" report and use "Grantee" as the "from" nodes and "Granted Role" as the "to" nodes.

en.extension_short_description: Detect Ransomware files on your monitored database servers. Powered by "Software Geology".
en.extension_long_description:
Ransomware taking over database servers is among the biggest concerns to organizations, as databases are where enterprise crown jewels are located. Worse, due to the easy access to anti-viruses, Ransomware writers can test their code against off-the-shelf anti-viruses, before launching their attack. Following, they can apply changes to their code, to make sure that the Ransomware won't be detected by the existing anti-viruses when they launch their campaign.

RansomShield, a new IBM Guardium application, powered by IBM Software Geology cloud technology, is designed specifically to protect database servers and to overcome the above mentioned limitations. RansomShield continuously monitors the file activity on database servers that are connected to IBM Guardium. The application has a concise dashboard that presents and tracks risk from ransomware, at different levels of resolution, starting with enterprise-level down to single database-server level.

Please contact calvin.bench@ibm.com for access to a Software Geology instance.

Blog post referencing RansomShield on the [IBM Security Community](https://community.ibm.com/community/user/security/blogs/calvin-bench/2018/10/08/how-guardium-is-adapting-to-the-wisdom-of-the-crow?CommunityKey=aa1a6549-4b51-421a-9c67-6dd41e65ef85&tab=recentcommunityblogsdashboard).

Code42 Next-Gen Data Loss Protection provides simple, fast detection & response to everyday data loss from insider threats by focusing on customer data on endpoints and the cloud to answer questions like:

- Where is my data?
- Where has my data been?
- When did my data leave?
- What data exactly left my organization?

The Code42 for Resilient app accelerates incident response by combining IBM Resilient’s market leading automation and incident handling with Code42’s context of file activity vastly accelerating the time to discovery and remediation of data loss incidents.

Departing Employee Use Case Example:

The Code42 for Resilient app is a key component when building out and implementing a well defined process for managing departing employees and ensuring that data does not leave the organization. It can automatically add full historical context of any data exfiltration or destruction for departing employees. This speeds up detection of data loss and with the capabilities of IBM Resilient accelerates incident response.

Malicious Files Use Case Example:

When data is taken by a departing employee, a never before seen malware is identified, or a Phishing campaign is identified, retrieving a copy of that file is difficult. Especially in the modern world of distributed workforces.

With the Code42 for Resilient app, actual files, from an arbitrary device, can be automatically attached to an Incident when it is created given an MD5 or similar identifying file information, regardless of where the containing device may physically be located.
en.extension_short_description: Simplifies and accelerates incident detection and response times associated with data loss

en.extension_name: IBM QRadar Data Exfiltration Content Extension
en.extension_short_description: QRadar extension pack for Data Exfiltration
en.extension_long_description:
The Data Exfiltration content pack provides rules and searches content to detect Data Exfiltration behaviour.

The Data Exfiltration content pack includes IBM custom properties as placeholders, which are meant to be replaced by specific Log Sources Properties. You can download other content extensions that include custom properties with these names, or you can create your own. See the documentation for more information on related content packs.

The use cases covered in this pack are the following:
1. Confidential/Sensitive File or Email Has Been uploaded to unsecure location or shared with remote asset or media (public accesses, guest accesses)
1. Email With a Confidential/Sensitive Attachment sent to a remote or malicious host
1. Excessive File Accesses or Downloads
1. File or Folder Accessed or Downloaded by a Malicious Domain or IP
1. Large outbound transfer
1. Large outbound transfer to malicious host
1. Large outbound transfer to online storage
1. Confidential or Sensitive File Has Been Accessed or Downloaded From a Foreign Country/Region
1. Data Loss Prevention device detection

The Data Exfiltration content pack also includes a Pulse Dashboard, which is compatible with the Pulse App.

Note:  In IBM QRadar 7.3.2 and earlier versions, the reference set does not link properly to "Files in Sensitive Directories - AlphaNumeric" to the rule response of "File Deleted from Sensitive File Directories". 
This was corrected in 7.3.2 patch 1. If you do not have 7.3.2 patch 1 installed, you can fix it manually (please refer to the documentation or the rule's notes).

Note: Internet connection is required to receive X-Force feeds.

en.extension_short_description: The McAfee Advanced Threat Defense (ATD) function analyzes a file or URL and sends the results back to Resilient.
en.extension_long_description:
**The McAfee Advanced Threat Defense Analyze File Function**

The McAfee Advanced Threat Defense (ATD) Analyze File Function uploads a file to be analyzed by McAfee ATD and returns the results to the IBM Resilient Incident Response Platform (IRP). Files can be uploaded from attachments, which can be from incidents, tasks, or artifacts.

**The McAfee Advanced Threat Defense Analyze URL Function**

The McAfee Advanced Threat Defense Analyze URL Function sends a URL to be analyzed by McAfee ATD and sends the results back to the Resilient IRP. The function is triggered from an artifact which has the URL, which can be from a site location or a link to download a file. When using a link to a site location, the URL is processed inside the analyzer VM and when using a link to a file, the file is downloaded and then analyzed.



Three example workflows and rules for using functions is included in The McAfee ATD Function package that can be copied and modified to suit your needs.

This integration is provided free of charge.
Should you wish to purchase this McAfee product, please contact [Nico.Devoti@mcafee.com](mailto:Nico.Devoti@mcafee.com)

app_details.ibmNaming_approval_number: Clearance Results for 94900241 - IBM QRadar DNS Analyzer - B36682

en.extension_long_description:
The IBM QRadar DNS Analyzer application provides insights into your local DNS traffic by identifying malicious activity and allowing your security team to be able to detect Domain Generated Algorithm (DGA), tunneling, or squatting domains that are being accessed from within your network. Utilizing QNI flows or logs with domain information from other devices such as DNS servers (BIND), proxies, Apache webservers or other BIND compatible devices you will be able to detect and monitor outbound requests to malicious sites. With the DNS Analyzer dashboard and drill down capabilities, your team can identify DNS trends and investigate activity such as squatting attempts.
  
*[User documentation](https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/en/SS42VS_7.3.1/com.ibm.qdaapp.doc/c_Qapps_QDA_intro.html)*  
  
*[Overview in IBM Security Learning Academy](https://www.securitylearningacademy.com/enrol/index.php?id=3714)*  
  
**Key capabilities:**
- DGA Domains detection and analytics.
- Squatting Domains detection and analytics.
- Tunneling Domains detection and analytics.
- Integration support for the IBM QRadar User Behavior Analytics (UBA) app and IBM QRadar Pulse app.
- Domain filtering (whitelist and blacklist) configuration settings.
- Proxy configuration settings for outbound traffic.
- Support for X-Force Threat Intelligence feed for domain categorization and filtering.
- Sorting capability for DGA/SQUATTING/TUNNELING/BLACKLIST/User Accessed Malicious domain events by source IP.
- DGA/SQUATTING/TUNNELING/BLACKLIST/User Accessed Malicious domain event list.
- DGA/SQUATTING/TUNNELING/BLACKLIST/User Accessed Malicious domain event creation and CRE response through QRadar.
- Configuration settings for enabling and disabling a specific analytic or event type.
- GDPR compliant.

**Notes:**
- After the installation is complete, you must clear your browser cache and refresh the browser window before you use the app.  
- Squatting event reporting is disabled by default since V1.3.0 to improve overall detection performance. Ensure to update to the latest X-Force Intelligence feed before you enable the Squatting functionality.

**ATTENTION: You must enable the X-Force Threat Intelligence Feed in QRadar before you can use the IBM QRadar DNS Analyzer app.**  

**ATTENTION: With optimal configuration, the QRadar DNS Analyzer app V1.4.1 handles a maximum of 200,000 DNS data flows per minute. In a network environment where DNS flow exceeds 200,000 per minute, some of the flows might not be analyzed.**  

**QRadar V7.3.2 only supports the DNS Analyzer app V1.4.0 and later. Older versions of the DNS Analyzer app must be upgraded to V1.4.0 prior to upgrading QRadar to V7.3.2.**
en.extension_short_description: Analyze DNS traffic to detect malicious activity within your organization.

en.extension_short_description: Extend device monitoring to  untrusted embedded devices, including medical instruments.
en.extension_long_description:
Irdeto’s **Cloakware Trusted Telemetry** features a small, portable agent well suited to extend security coverage even to tiny microprocessor and RTOS based systems. Critical security events are passed by default in the protected telemetry packets and agent APIs make it easy to add additional system or application level data as required. Having robust, reliable security telemetry data can help SIEM systems such as QRadar scale to accommodate the massive increase in connected devices that we are experiencing today.  Trusted Telemetry provides near real-time detection of device exploits for timely containment.

**Trusted / robust security telemetry** 
- Provides both system and application level telemetry data
- Produces reliable critical security events, like:
- - Integrity Verification (detect tampering)
- - Hooking detection
- - Jailbreak / rooting detection
- - Privilege escalation
 - Easy API to extend protections to device apps and for apps
to produce proprietary telemetry

**Server plays well with others** . 
- Telemetry server provided to process messages, store and
forward events
- Containerized server for easy deployment
- Available as part of Cloakware Software Services or
separately
- Seamless integration with popular SIEM systems like IBM’s
QRadar

**Agent provides broad device coverage** . 
- Portable C code for broadest possible device coverage
- Small size (footprint)
- Simplified OS abstraction layer for easy porting
- Pre-integrations for several popular embedded OS (Inquire
about rollout)
- iOS, Linux, FreeRTOS
- Android, Wear OS, VxWorks,  uCOS, ThreadX, in
future (inquire)

en.extension_short_description: Bi-directional integration with ServiceNow and IBM Resilient
en.extension_long_description:
**Bi-directional** integration with ServiceNow and IBM Resilient allowing SEC Ops Professionals to communicate security incidents in realtime. This integration allows for bi-directional synchronization of Incidents, Tasks, Notes and Attachments enabling the security and operations teams to be aligned during critical security events.

**Key Features**

* Bi-directional integration between Records in the ServiceNow Incident Table and Incidents and Tasks in the IBM Resilient platform.
* Create a Resilient Incident or Task from a ServiceNow Record in the Incident Table.
* Create a ServiceNow Record in the Incident Table from a Resilient Incident or Task.
* Sync notes between a related Resilient Incident or Task and a ServiceNow Record.
* Send Attachments from a Resilient Incident or Task to a related ServiceNow Record.

**Requirements**
* ServiceNow Instance with ITSM enabled and running a **Kingston**, **London** or **Madrid** release
* The ServiceNow **IBM Resilient App >= v1.0.0** installed on your ServiceNow Instance which you can download from [the ServiceNow Store](http://ibm.biz/get-ibm-resilient-service-now-app)
* Access to the **Incident Table** in ServiceNow
* If IBM Resilient is not publicly accessible (behind firewall) a ServiceNow MID Server is required
* IBM Resilient >= **v31.0.0**
* An Integrations Server running **resilient-circuits >= v31.0.0** with **fn_service_now >= v1.0.0** installed which you can download from our [App Exchange](http://ibm.biz/get-ibm-resilient-service-now-integration)

**Documentation + Guides**
- See [ibm.biz/res-snow-docs](http://ibm.biz/res-snow-docs) for our latest documentation

en.extension_short_description: Discover, enrich, and act on information available in IBM Resilient using the CYBRIC platform.
en.extension_long_description: The IBM Resilient - CYBRIC integration creates a seamless connection between the two platforms. CYBRIC protected artifacts (e.g. IP addresses, URLs) that are added to a Resilient incident are enriched with all the vulnerability and weakness data available in the CYBRIC platform.  This information can be leveraged to better understand the root cause of the incident and provide faster remediation.  Users can also be redirected to the CYBRIC platform where they can get visibility into the applications that the artifacts are part of in order to get a more comprehensive picture of their overall risk profile.  The IBM Resilient - CYBRIC integration provides users a continuous view into the security posture and level of resiliency of their environment, that ultimately leads to a more proactive remediation of the known vulnerabilities and faster resolution of incidents.

en.extension_short_description: The Tenable plugin for MaaS360 provides a non-intrusive way to detect security vulnerabilities on their mobile devices.
en.extension_long_description:
The Tenable plugin for MaaS360 provides a way for security teams to understand the cyber exposure of all their mobile devices being managed by MaaS360. Tenable collects all mobile device hardware and software information by importing asset lists and asset metadata from the MaaS360 server. Tenable.sc or Tenable.io then runs its vulnerability scan plugin data against the mobile device profile to determine vulnerabilities. Customers can then generate comprehensive reports to better understand their Cyber Exposure and risk and help ensure compliance across their mobile environment. 

More information can be found at: https://docs.tenable.com/cloud/Content/Scans/Mobile.htm?Highlight=Maas360

en.extension_short_description: Develop new apps and edit existing apps in realtime on the QRadar Console.
en.extension_long_description:
The QRadar App Editor is an easy-to-use editor that any app developer can use. When you use the App Editor to develop a new app or import an existing app, the App Editor is on the app development tab. The App Editor is a ready-made workspace for you to manage the development of your app.  

**What you can do with the QRadar App Editor**
- Develop new apps from a starter template automatically imported from the IBM sample apps repository.
- Import and edit existing apps via file upload or cloning a git repository.
- Delete apps that you create with the App Editor.
- Add, edit, reorder and remove files and folders.
- Clone an app from a Git repository.
- Deploy apps that you’re editing and developing.
- Export apps.

**How the App Editor works**  
When you install a new app or import an existing app into QRadar, you use the App Editor to edit and create files and folders on the app development tab. When you’re satisfied with your changes, you can deploy the app to live mode to represent how the app functions in QRadar. In live mode the app development tab is removed.

**Go to the [QRadar App Development community](https://developer.ibm.com/qradar/) for help, tips, and ideas for building your own apps.  
To view and contribute to the current sample apps visit the [QRadar sample apps repository.](https://github.com/ibm-security-intelligence/sample-apps)**

**Note**  
This extension requires Python2.7 to be available. App support for Python 2.7 is available via:
- IBM® Security QRadar® 7.2.8: Patch 7 (7.2.8.20170530170730)
- IBM® Security QRadar® 7.3.0: Patch 2 (7.3.0.20170620100024)
- IBM® Security QRadar® 7.3.1 GA
- IBM® Security QRadar® 7.3.2 GA  

Please ensure your QRadar console version is greater than or equal to those stated above.  

You can't import an app that is packaged as an extension that you download from the IBM App Exchange. You can unzip the app extension to extract the compressed (.zip) file, and then use the App Editor to import the app compressed (.zip) file.

If you experience any issues with the chrome browser on Mac, upgrade to the latest version or use the Firefox browser.

To see the detailed features, please watch this video - [click here.](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PI46BCvqRkM/)

en.extension_short_description: The AetherPal Remote Support Connector integrates Remote Support into the MaaS360 Portal.
en.extension_long_description:
The AetherPal Remote Support Connector integrates Remote Support into the MaaS360 Portal for easy access to remote support to troubleshoot and resolve issues with mobile devices and apps, which significantly increases user uptime and satisfaction.

The AetherPal Remote Support Connector provides the mobile user with streamlined configuration of the AetherPal MSM app through App Config and provides the Admin/Help Desk with quick access to Remote Support through a URL in the MaaS360 portal. 
 
AetherPal’s Remote Support makes supporting mobile devices and applications effortless. Remote Support provides your IT staff with real-time remote control, visibility, and access to mobile devices, helping to improve productivity and efficiency, while reducing downtime. Remote Support boosts IT and mobile worker productivity by quickly and securely connecting to devices to troubleshoot and resolve device, network, or app issues.

en.extension_short_description: Helps accelerate investigation by providing security and network access context for offenses.
en.extension_long_description: RedSeal's security analytics platform builds an accurate, up-to-date model of an organization's entire as-built network to visualize access paths and prioritize what to fix to protect the most valuable assets in the network. Through RedSeal's integration with QRadar, the app helps to accelerate investigation by providing security and network access context for offenses that QRadar identifies. This includes information on the location in the network of an offense, visibility into downstream critical assets at risk, and dashboard access to powerful RedSeal functionality. This functionality identifies which top reachable groups and targets are accessible from the threat source, prioritized by network access risk, and allows the user to view a Detailed Path of network access from the threat source to any target asset across your network.

en.extension_short_description: A Resilient function to isolate CarbonBlack endpoints

It is designed to be used in conjunction with CarbonBlack, using the CarbonBlack Agent and Server to remove all communications in and out of a device in case of infection or suspicious activity.

en.extension_short_description: Sends data and information from Resilient to a Kafka message bus topic
en.extension_long_description:
This functions takes any data from Resilient such as incidents or artifacts, and can dispatch them to a topic on a Kafka Message Bus. 

This is a proof of concept integration, i.e. more an academic exercise than a production integration. It doesn't support authenticated Kafka although this functionality could be trivially added. The alternative is a Kafka broker is installed on your integration server to consume via local relay. 

The topic is configurable from the workflow to allow for different workflows to send to different topics. 

If you would like enhancements to this function then please contact the developer via the forum.

en.extension_short_description: Accelerate incident response by enriching incident data and executing search anremediation actions from within Resilient
en.extension_long_description:
By integrating BigFix with the Resilient Incident Response Platform, security teams can orchestrate incident response processes with automatic and manual enrichment and targeted remediation actions. Teams can investigate the breadth and depth of an attack by hunting for IOCs across the enterprise, and quickly respond to attacks by executing endpoint remediation actions, such as killing processes, from within the Resilient platform.

This integration performs the following operations:

* Query a BigFix server for any endpoints with IOC hits for an artifact of type 
        IP Address, Process Name, Service (MS Windows), File path or Registry Key 
        (MS Windows).
* Remediate a hit on an endpoint or asset in a BigFix environment.
* Retrieve status of a BigFix action.
* Query a BigFix server for properties of an endpoint (asset).

en.extension_short_description: Industrial Cyber Threat Detection, Vulnerability and Risk.
en.extension_long_description:
iSID enables non-disruptive monitoring of distributed SCADA networks for changes in topology and behaviour, using six security packages, each offering a unique capability pertaining to a specific type of network activity:

a. NETWORK VISIBILITY
Using passive scanning of all OT network traffic, iSID creates a visual network model for all devices, protocols and sessions, with alerts upon detected topology changes (e.g. new devices or sessions.

b. CYBER ATTACK
The Cyber Attack package handles known threats designed to the SCADA network, including PLCs, RTUs and industrial protocols, based on data from research labs as well as Radiflow’s own research.

c. POLICY MONITORING
Define/modify policies for each network link, for validating specific commands (e.g. “write to controller”) and operational ranges (e.g. “do not set turbine to above 800 rpm.”)

d. MAINTENANCE MANAGEMENT
Limit network exposure during scheduled maintenance by creating work orders for specific devices during set time-windows. A log report of all maintenance activities is issued upon session completion.

e. ANOMALY DETECTION
The Anomaly Detection package creates a behavioural network model using multiple parameters, including device sequence sampling time, frequency of operational values and more, toward detecting behavioural anomalies.

f. OPERATIONAL BEHAVIOR
Monitor and audit the management of devices (PLC, RTU & IED) at remote sites, with alerts for firmware changes or configuration modifications (e.g. software updates or turning edge devices on or off) and activity logging.

en.extension_short_description: Enables developers to create extensions that enrich your QRadar system with new functionality.
en.extension_long_description:
The IBM Security QRadar application framework has its own software development kit (SDK) that is downloadable from the IBM Security App Exchange. All users interested in extending QRadar to use the SDK and the IBM QRadar GUI Application Framework can develop new extensions that integrate with QRadar and provide new capabilities. The software development kit (SDK) can be used to create a development workspace, run apps locally for QA test purposes, or package your app to create an archive (.zip file) that contains your extension files. The IBM QRadar SDK is intended to help users develop and deploy apps to your QRadar Console. 

For more information, development questions, forums, and official documentation, see our new [QRadar App Development Center](https://developer.ibm.com/qradar/).

en.extension_short_description: Convert HTML data to a PDF document
en.extension_long_description:
This function converts HTML data into a base64 encoded PDF document. Alternatively, it converts the contents of a website URL into a base64 encoded document.

This function can be used in sequence with other functions, such as fn_utilities:json2html and fn_utilities:base64_to_attachment.

en.extension_short_description: Workflow function to analyze URLs using the Thug honeyclient.
en.extension_long_description:
Thug is a Python low-interaction honeyclient aimed at mimicing the behavior of a web browser in order to detect and emulate malicious contents.

This Resilient Function package can be used to analyze a url for malicious content using thug. It uses a dockerized thug container to run analysis in a detached container then cleans up the output files and container after execution completes.

en.extension_short_description: Provides classes to create mobile apps that interact with IBM Access Manager and IBM Cloud Identity.
en.extension_long_description:
The IBM Security Verify SDK provides programmatic access to IBM Security related technologies through REST API endpoints. Apps can use the IBM Security Verify SDK to build rich native client mobile applications that handle the authentication operations for cloud-based and on-premise deployments.

The IBM Security Verify SDK includes a set of authentication challenge mechanisms to enable application developers to respond to multi-factor authentication (MFA) events triggered from server-side policy logic. The IBM Security Verify SDK also is extensible so that developers can create their own MFA based challenges and handle the client interaction.

en.extension_short_description: AppVision’s HackGuard Enterprise executable code protection and monitoring solution for mobile Android and iOS apps.
en.extension_long_description:
HackGuard is different – its unique technology enables strong protection for “public facing” mobile apps, those running on customers' uncontrolled, unmanageable, highly-vulnerable endpoints. Without a solution like HackGuard, the vital executable code of public facing mobile apps cannot be effectively monitored, protected, or remediated.

There’s a rule of thumb for public-facing apps: public app users will outnumber internal users (employees) by a factor of 200X. So an organization with 1,000 employees will typically have around 200,000 public app users. That’s 200,000 smartphones, tablets, and notebooks over which you have no control. Until you have detailed information about the environments your app is operating in, your attack surface is expansive and your security team is blind.

THAT IS WHY HACKGUARD IS THE NATURAL COMPLEMENT TO MDM, EXTENDING YOUR MANAGEMENT CAPABILITIES TO THE OTHER 99.5% OF YOUR ATTACK SURFACE.

AppVision's HackGuard is an Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR) solution designed specifically to protect mobile app executable code and provide deep discovery of an app’s operating environment.

Think of HackGuard as a guardian angel, lightly sitting on the shoulder of your mobile app, keeping it safe wherever it goes. HackGuard is an effective, easy to implement, and affordable Software as a Service (SaaS) solution. It enables Mobile App Publishers and Enterprises to deploy strong app code protection and gain worldwide app base monitoring in just minutes.

HACKGUARD TECHNOLOGY BENEFITS

HackGuard provides protection for Mobile Apps against hacking and malicious threats while providing publishers with unprecedented visibility into their installed user base.

HackGuard's executable application code protection and deep discovery of the protected app's operating environment enables organizations to quickly and easily identify specific endpoints within their installed user base that are most at risk for attacks. This proactive approach enables you to detect the instant your app base comes under attack. This drastically reduces monetary losses, reputational harm and the specter of regulatory requirements mandating public disclosure of breaches.

HackGuard is mobile app security that works all of the time, on every device, and against all kinds of attacks. If consumer trust is the linchpin of your entire business model, make sure HackGuard has your back — and your apps.

en.extension_short_description: A generic script for incoming email to create and update incidents, including artifacts from the body and headers.
en.extension_long_description:
Resilient V32 includes features that receive and process incoming email using scripts and rules.  This extension consists of a generic script and rule to provide default processing for incoming emails.  It provides a quick and powerful way to get started with incoming emails from systems (SIEM, network devices, and other security alerts) and people (phishing reports and other security alerts).

**Functionality**

The script performs the following:
* Checks for an existing incident whose title reflects the email message received.
  * If found, it associates the email message with the existing incident.
  * Otherwise, it creates a new incident with a suitable title.
* Parses the email body text for URLs, IP addresses and file hashes. After filtering out invalid and whitelisted values, it adds the remaining data to the incident as artifacts.
* Adds non-inline email message attachments to the incident.

**Extending and Customizing**

This script is intended as a sample to be customized and extended for your own needs, such as:
* Setting the owner for new incidents,
* Configuring lists of "known good" IP addresses, ranges, and domains that should not be processed into artifacts,
* Creating additional custom scripts that handle specific email types, set incident type based on email contents, populate custom fields, and other activities specific to your needs.

These extensions and customizations are described in the attached documentation.

**Support**

Due to the need to extend and customize this script for your own purposes, support provided only via the [community forum](http://ibm.biz/resilientcommunity).

en.extension_short_description: Experience the power of QRadar quickly and easily.

After watching the video tutorial that explains the use case, you can easily explore the QRadar content that is used for the use case, and further explore how you might investigate such a threat in your own environment.

The app also gives you the capability to upload and play your own logs in QRadar, as well as provides access to many QRadar learning resources, making it the ideal way to learn how you can use the powerful threat detection capabilities of IBM QRadar to protect your network.  **This app is not suitable for production systems as it sends events that cannot be removed from the system. As such, it is best suited to a test environment.**

[Learn how to run and analyze common QRadar use cases by using the Threat Simulator in the Experience Center app](https://www.securitylearningacademy.com/course/view.php?id=3673).

This version of the app is not fully supported in IBM QRadar Community Edition.

After extraction, the information is displayed in the IBM QRadar "IxFlow dashboard" extension. The Ixia IxFlow fields collected by IBM QRadar are enhanced IPFIX records, which provide information about; geo-location, application names, operating systems, browsers, providers, latency, URL, hostnames, DNS and SSL (encryption type, cipher names, key length).

Ixia IxFlow brings essential information to security teams to quickly identify potential exposures and breaches. For example, a review of countries to and from which the traffic is flowing, or looking at the top applications, top network talkers, cipher names, encryption key length, or threat information; can quickly provide key information to speed up troubleshooting and awareness.

en.extension_short_description: Symantec Endpoint Protection Mobile offers a comprehensive, accurate and effective mobile threat defense (MTD) solution
en.extension_long_description:
Symantec Endpoint Protection Mobile (SEP Mobile) offers a comprehensive mobile threat defense solution for both managed and unmanaged devices, delivering superior depth of threat intelligence to help predict, detect and prevent an extensive range of known and unknown threats. SEP Mobile's advanced technology uses a layered approach that leverages massive crowd-sourced threat intelligence, in addition to both device- and server-based analysis, to proactively help protect enterprise mobile devices against malware, network threats, and vulnerability exploits.

Malware protection methods include static and dynamic analysis, crowd-based anomaly detection, as well as analysis based on signatures, app behavior, structure, permissions and more, all which may lead to blocking the installation, removing malicious apps, and even terminating malicious processes. Protection against network threats includes an automated VPN response that protects the device while maintaining network connectivity during an attack. For certain real-time protections of the device and the sensitive information it has access to, SEP Mobile employs its unique mobile network access control (mNAC) to selectively access and connections to help ensure security and prevent data leakage during an attack, while continuing to allow non-critical connections. SEP Mobile provides a comprehensive risk assessment of an organization and each device, and integrates with all major EMMs.

en.extension_short_description: Pinpoint unauthorized wireless devices and disable phones in no-phone zones. Inpixon Indoor Positioning Analytics (IPA)

The IPA platform allows organizations to implement a layered approach to wireless security to identify, locate, and position wireless cellular, Wi-Fi, and Bluetooth devices. The IPA Security solution provides wireless intrusion detection that will “see” any and all fixed and mobile RF emissions, locate the source, and position the device on a floorplan, providing full visibility into wireless environments. 
The most common use case is to disable a phone's camera, audio recorder and transmission functions while in a high security, no-cell-phones zone. This capability helps to prevent recording of confidential conversations, theft of intellectual property, and transmission/reception of voice and data while in the zone.

Using the included DSM, IBM QRadar collects, processes, aggregates, and stores both events and enriched traffic flow data, in either JSON or LEEF format, from the Illumio Advanced Security Platform Policy Compute Engine (PCE) in real time

A Device Support Module (DSM)is installed on your QRadar system ingests the data and stores them in reference tables. Log Source and Log Source Types definitions for Illumio data are provided by the DSM, with the label "Illumio ASP v2". 

The app collects event and other data from the PCE via the Illumio REST API and also using syslog, in either LEEF or JSON format.

The Illumio App for QRadar presents dashboards for visibility. For traffic monitoring and security operations, the Security Operations dashboard can help pinpoint
potential attacks and identify compromised workloads. For data exploration, the Investigation dashboard includes top 1,000 investigations.

en.extension_long_description:
SecurityScorecard is a security ratings platform that enables enterprises to instantly rate and understand the security risk of companies, non-intrusively and from an outside-in perspective. We use an A-F rating scale. Companies with a C, D or F rating are 5.4 times more likely to be breached or face compliance penalties than companies with an A or B rating. Our platform is used by hundreds of customers for use-cases including vendor risk management, cyber insurance, board reporting, and M&A. Headquartered in New York City, we are funded by top investors like Sequoia Capital, Google Ventures, NGP, Moody’s, Intel, and others.  Our vision is to create a new language for companies and their partners to communicate, understand, and improve each other’s security posture.


**SecurityScorecard Key Differentiators**
- Superior Service - After working with other vendors, customers point to SecurityScorecard’s customer service as the number one reason for moving to the platform. 
- Platform Performance - Our platform is designed to be transparent and collaborative, enabling security teams and vendors to work together - vendors can access the platform at no cost
- Best-in-class vendor resolution capabilities - we have a team that works directly with vendors to resolve open issues and findings


**Customer Value**

The integration will offer QRadar customers the ability to monitor three components of the SecurityScorecard platform:
- SecurityScorecard’s overall letter-grade security ratings, which give customers the ability to quickly and easily understand the cybersecurity posture of an organization via an easy-to-understand A-F rating scale
- SecurityScorecard’s underlying factor data in key risk categories, including Application Security, Malware, Patching Cadence, Network Security, Hacker Chatter, Social Engineering, and Passwords Exposed. Each of these factors is predictive.For example, companies with a C, D, or F rating in Social Engineering are more than 400% more likely to experience a data breach than those with an A or B rating.
- SecurityScorecard issue-related data, which offers a breadth and depth of critical data points across 87 different issue types not available from any other security ratings provider

en.extension_short_description: An Insider Threat management solution.
en.extension_long_description:
The ObserveIT App for IBM QRadar provides security analysts and investigation teams with powerful user activity metadata, smart user behavior alerts, and powerful user context to help identify and investigate Insider Threats and other user-based threats directly from within the App. Security teams can correlate ObserveIT metadata with other data sources to create smarter alerts and stop threats before they happen. 

QRadar provides a robust solution for Security Information and Event Management (SIEM), anomaly detection, incident forensics, and vulnerability management. When ObserveIT is set up as a data source for QRadar, all ObserveIT metadata and alerts are integrated into the QRadar Console, allowing you to create graphical summaries of the data, search for specific sessions and alerts by user, endpoint, application, time range, and so on, drill down to see alert details, and link to full video playback.  
Using the ObserveIT App for IBM QRadar, analysts can:  
- View and search for recorded user interface and command line activities. 
- View and search for user behavior alerts. 
- View detailed summaries of user session activity – applications that were run, files copied, printing, and so on. 
- Link from all events to recorded playback.

en.extension_short_description: Enrich security incidents with insights from Watson to rapidly respond to threats.
en.extension_long_description:
QRadar Advisor with Watson combines the cognitive capabilities of Watson and the industry leading QRadar Security Analytics Platform to uncover hidden threats and automate insights. The QRadar Advisor with Watson app will enrich security incidents compiled by the QRadar platform with insights from Watson for Cyber Security to investigate and respond to threats at unprecedented speed and scale. By augmenting the analyst’s ability to act on threats with confidence, Watson revolutionizes the way security analysts work.

Requirements:

To install and run the QRadar Advisor with Watson app, you will need to have the following set up in your environment:

*   **IBM QRadar version 7.3.1 Patch 7 IF 01** or higher
*   Local and Remote security monitoring
*   QRadar Console Internet Access required

If you do not have QRadar in your environment, you can learn more about QRadar Security analytics platform [here](http://www-03.ibm.com/software/products/en/qradar) .

**Get prepared by Upgrading to QRadar 7.3.1**

[Patch documentation](https://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg27050575)

[Upgrade documentation](https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SS42VS_7.3.1/com.ibm.qradar.doc/b_qradar_upgrade.pdf?view=kc)

**Getting Started**

*   How to install and activate the trial – [Watson Installation](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jstU-1_vPYc)
*   How to properly configure your app in the QRadar platform – [Watson Configuration](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=anibI6oSbBc)
*   How to investigate and explore security incidents with QRadar Advisor with Watson – [Watson Analysis](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ShxYctvwYQw)
*   Support for QRadar Advisor with Watson - [Click here](https://developer.ibm.com/qradar/advisor/)

**After the installation or upgrade process is complete, you must clear your browser cache and refresh the browser window before you use the app.**

**Attention: Version 2.0.0 of the QRadar Advisor with Watson app is supported only on QRadar V7.3.1 and later.**
*   Starting with V2.0.0, QRadar Advisor with Watson is no longer supported on QRadar V7.2.8 and V7.3.0. Contact your support representative for an older, supported version (V1.17.0) of the app.
*   Memory requirements have increased to 1224 MB.

en.extension_long_description:
QRadar Cloud Visibility is a multi-cloud solution to manage and provide security for Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, and IBM Cloud environments. The app leverages existing QRadar cloud integrations that bring log data from Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) environments into QRadar, and utilizes rules from QRadar's cloud content extensions in the IBM Security App Exchange. Using these data streams and security use cases, QRadar can detect cloud misconfigurations (such as those common in AWS S3 buckets or Azure Blob storage) and identify threats. The Cloud Visibility app enables analysts to visualize potential offenses in AWS, Microsoft Azure, and IBM Cloud.
  
Enhanced AWS capabilities:

- Simplified log source management
- Identity and access management for accounts, users, and IAM roles
- Auto-population of QRadar Network Hierarchy
- Amazon VPC flow log visualization


Note: The app works on QRadar versions 7.2.8+ with limited functionality. For full functionality, install on QRadar V7.3.1 or above.

1.2.0: Added a setup wizard to make it easier to set up your AWS accounts for the app.

Added four new AWS Offense dashboard charts: 
	- All account IDs by magnitude
	- All account IDs by related rule
	- All resource types by magnitude
	- All resource types by related rule
Added AWS CloudTrail notifications in the CloudTrail Log Sources tab.
Added the ability to view, edit, and delete log sources in the app, eliminating the need to link to the IBM QRadar console.

Added Amazon VPC flow log visualization.
	Note:  VPC flows are not supported on QRadar on Cloud.
1.1.0: Added proxy configuration settings
Enhanced filters now available in sidebar
Improved the validation of the AWS cross-account setup (requires updating the policy JSON in AWS)

en.extension_long_description:
Resilient functions simplify development of integrations by wrapping each external activity into an individual workflow component. These components can be easily installed, then used and combined in Resilient workflows. The Resilient platform sends data to the function component that performs an activity then returns the results to the workflow. The results can be acted upon by scripts, rules, and workflow decision points to dynamically orchestrate the security incident response activities

The Utility Functions integration package contains several useful workflow functions for common automation and integration activities in Resilient.  These include:
* Function to call generic REST/JSON web service APIs,
* Function to run arbitrary shell scripts (bash and PowerShell),
* Functions to fetch SSL certificates from a server and parse them,
* Functions to work with Excel, HTML, XML, JSON and EML files,
* Functions to work with Resilient attachments:  calculate hashes, list and extract ZIP archives, convert to and from base64
* Function to parse .eml and .msg email files
* Function to pause a workflow for a specified amount of time.
* And more.

en.extension_short_description: Fully automate time-consuming security tasks to streamline the efficiency of your SOC team.
en.extension_long_description:
SOCAutomation delivers advanced automation, orchestration and integration capabilities into your QRadar and SOC Operations ecosystem, including internal and external processes and workflows, security and IT systems.
Adding state-of-the-art automation to your QRadar environment allows your existing security investment to shine by automating complex systems interactions and time-consuming tasks with ticketing systems, workflows, firewalls, endpoints, servers, email, applications, and other security products like Resilient Systems, forensics tools, sandboxing, threat intelligence, IPS/IDS - in fact any technology in your security investment where you want to leverage automation to save time, money and reduce risk.
Because SOCAutomation is a fully-fledged automation system with built-in modeling and workflow support, the creation and maintenance of even highly complex automation scenarios is fast, easy and most importantly, consistent.
SOCAutomation includes a large library of common use-cases, and fully tracks, audits and reports on all offense generation.
SOCAutomation is fully multi-tenanted and role-based, and includes CSIRT-level data access control mechanisms to ensure data isolation and protection.

en.extension_short_description: Password service that automatically creates and enters passwords.
en.extension_long_description:
Authentication service that automatically generates and enters a password for you.

AutoPassword™ is a password replacement technology that automatically enters a password when a user enters their ID on an online service, and verifies whether the correct password is entered to the user as a form of mutual authentication.

AutoPassword™ can't be stolen as it is newly generated every time, this means users don’t have to memorize or enter passwords. Before authentication, the solution validates that an online service is legitimate and not a phishing site.

en.extension_name: Cisco AMP for Endpoints integration for Resilient
en.extension_short_description: Integration with Cisco AMP for Endpoints to allow querying and updating of an AMP for Endpoints deployment.
en.extension_long_description:
Cisco AMP for Endpoints is a REST API-based solution for querying the Cisco AMP for Endpoint cloud-managed environment.
This Functions-based integration allows for the enrichment of Resilient data using the results returned from the Cisco AMP for Endpoints API and also to make updates to the Cisco AMP for Endpoint environment.
This integration performs the following operations:

- Get computer, computers or groups
- Get computer trajectory
- Get activity
- Get event types or events

The integration can also make the following changes to a Cisco AMP for Endpoints environment:
- Add suspicious sha-256 values to a file list which can then be used to blacklist the related file.
- Delete sha-256 values from a file list.
- Move a computer to a new group.

See the attached document for descriptions on each included function, how to configure them in custom workflows, and any additional customization options.

Guardium to QRadar Exporter facilitates sending predefined policy-violation reports quickly and easily from Guardium to QRadar. The reports can be sent ad hoc or at regular interval.

Guardium to QRadar Exporter makes it an easier and more streamlined experience to map reports from Guardium to QRadar - avoid creating a template and audit process (e.g. column one is timestamp, column two is client id, etc then pushing to syslog).

**List of Available Exports**  
- Sensitive Data To Discovery
- Access Log
- Exception Log
- Full SQL
- Session Log
- Group Members
- Policy Violations
- Analytic Outliers Details List - Enhanced
- Compliance Reports


Make sure to download most recent QRadar - Guardium content pack to ensure proper mappings between Guardium reports and QRadar events: 
[QRadar Content Pack Download Page](https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/hub/extension/IBMQRadar:IBMGuardiumCustomProperties)

en.extension_name: FraudLogix IP Threat Intel for IBM QRadar
en.extension_short_description: Identify infected devices, bots & malware. Endpoint data gathered from 640 million users monthly via JavaScript sensors.
en.extension_long_description:
Fraudlogix protects the world’s largest advertising exchanges and networks from serving ads to
infected devices, bots and malware. These same devices are used by threat actors for nonadvertising
related activities such as DDoS attacks, unauthorized login attempts, data theft
breaches, etc.

The data is generated via the Fraudlogix JavaScript sensors that sit on over 12 million URLs,
collecting endpoint data directly from 640 million unique users and 1.2 billion unique devices
monthly. The IP intelligence includes risk score and reason code for each IP. Deeper threat
event data is available upon request.

**To View a short explanatory video [click here](http://ws.fraudlogix.com/videos/qradar/)**

**Sign up for a free 30-day test account [click here](http://info.fraudlogix.com/ip-intelligence-30-day-test)**

The Fraudlogix application for IBM QRadar enables:
- Access to an aggregated collection of IPs with elevated risk levels as indicators that there is a
high probability that devices from these IPs have been compromised.
- Access to reference sets that cross-check if an IP in a client’s data is part of the Fraudlogix data
set.
- The ability to see the risk status of an IP by hovering over it.
- The ability to lookup additional information on an IP by right clicking on it. Information available
includes specific activity that caused an IP’s risk level to be elevated (e.g. bot activity), details on
the specific device(s) seen (e.g., user agent, operating system, browser, etc.), the times, dates,
locations, and ASNs of suspected malicious instances, and more.

The Fraudlogix application for IBM QRadar can help users to identify compromised devices and
vulnerabilities within their networks or that of their clients, assess the risk of internal and external
traffic, assess the vulnerabilities of a network, flag/block transactions and/or access from high-risk IPs,
and more.

The DomainTools Iris App for Resilient provides access to domain profiles, domain risk score, and connected domain names delivered by the DomainTools Iris Investigate API. 

The functions enable key use cases including retrieving data from Iris, extracting important components such as risk score, and conducting automated pivots to map threat actor infrastructure. 

The app includes reference workflows and associated rules that enable in-context enrichment of domain name artifacts. Annotations and processing scripts embedded in the workflows offer guidance to realize higher-value outcomes with the rich Iris dataset, including automated blocking and remediation with Domain Risk Score.

en.extension_name: Kaspersky Threat Intelligence Portal for Resilient
en.extension_long_description:
Kaspersky Threat Intelligence Portal for Resilient provides the fastest and easiest way to get threat intelligence from [Kaspersky Threat Intelligence Portal](https://tip.kaspersky.com) about artifacts in incidents stored in Resilient. Kaspersky Threat Intelligence Portal delivers all the knowledge acquired by Kaspersky Lab about cyber-threats and their relationships, brought together into a single, powerful web service. The goal is to provide your security teams with as much data as possible, preventing cyber-attacks before they impact your organization.

 - RF Get IP Risk – Query the Risk Rating information for an IP address.
 - RF Get User Risk - Query the Risk Rating information for a username.
 - RF Get Action Plans – Query the set of action plans for an account.
 - RF Get Risk Model Instances – Query the set of Risk Model Instances.
 - RF Get Risk Model Instance Details – Get the set of Event Scenario for a Risk Model 
 - RF Set Classifications – Update Event Classification for an Action Plan.
 - RF Set Mitigations – Update Mitigation statues for an Action Plan.

Example Workflows:

Plans. Requires creating and configuring an Incident Type, ex. "RF Action Plan".

Models. Requires creating and configuring an Incident Type, ex. "RF Risk Model".

en.extension_short_description: CB Protection integration for Resilient allows users to approve or ban files on a system running CB Protection.
en.extension_long_description:
The CB Protection integration for Resilient escalates potential unauthorized file access actions to Resilient and allows Resilient users the ability to investigate, approve or ban those file actions on the target CB Protection system.

In a typical use case, a user installing software or using unauthorized software on a system that has CB Protection will encounter a pop-up to submit an approval request for access. This integration uses a polling mechanism to escalate newly created approval requests to Resilient as incidents including artifacts containing the hashes of the file in question. Within Resilient, the SOC Analyst can authorize or deny the installation of the file globally or locally on the originating system using CB Protection integration workflows accessible through incident menu items. Results of the approval or ban request are written to an incident note in Resilient and to custom incident fields displayed on the CB Protection incident tab. A link back to the CB Protection Approval Request Details page is available in the results.

Included in the package are the following Resilient functions:
CbProtect Delete File
CbProtect Delete File Rule or Id
CbProtect Get Approval Request for Id
CbProtect Get Approval Request for Query Condition
CbProtect Get File Catalog for Id
CbProtect Get File Catalog for Query Condition
CbProtect Get File Instance for Query Conditions
CbProtect Get File Rule for Id
CbProtect Get File Rule for Query Condition
CbProtect Update Approval Request
CbProtect Update File Instance Local State
CbProtect Update File Rule

Also included are the following example workflows and corresponding rules to invoke the workflows:
(Example) CbProtect Approve File Globally and Close Request
(Example) CbProtect Approve File Locally and Close Request
(Example) CbProtect Ban File Globally and Close Request
(Example) CbProtect Get Approval Request
(Example) CbProtect Get Approval Request by Query Condition 	
(Example) CbProtect Get File Catalog for Query Condition

en.extension_short_description: QSM easily tracks user network activity following initial authentication using the logs without username
en.extension_long_description:
**QSM or QRadar Session Manager** makes it easy to manage user sessions and investigate security events using session information even if user name is not available in log messages e.g.:

 
- Firewall activity
- IDS/IPS activity
- Web Servers activity
- Operating Systems logs missing username
- Database and business application queries
- Others


Simply type username or IP address into QSM (or right click username/IP in Log Activity tab, select 'Open with QSM') and choose a time frame to look up all sessions and related activity from all log sources.


QSM is a must have in case you have a lot of users utilizing DHCP who frequently switch from IP to IP (e.g. huge wireless network with many access points) and in many other scenarios.


**Detailed description**


QSM tracks user sessions from initial authentication until timeout/repeat authentication from the same IP address and stores session information in special log source within QRadar. 


Runtime (active) session information is stored in memory so when session is closed for any reason, the session finalization information gets to QRadar log source. This allows to apply native QRadar retention settings to QSM data and review session information directly inside QRadar interface.


Session info in QSM includes all session event fields available in QRadar: *Log Source Name, Event Name, IP addresses, Custom Properties – essentially anything you can query using AQL*.


**Configuration**


QSM is highly customizable: you can create different profiles for connecting different QRadar instances (QSM needs to be installed and configured on each QRadar instance) via API, define columns for user activity tracking view, enable/disable debug mode, and choose grouping criteria for session activity report.


Configure QSM and unlock its full functionality by following the steps below:


- Modify default QSM rule to forward specific authentication events to QSM (not mandatory)
- Configure Connection Profile within QSM application
- Configure Forwarding Destination in QRadar


Detailed configuration information is available inside QSM UI under help section and in QSM Admin Guide on IBM App Exchange. QSM package includes:


- QSM Application
- QSM Custom DSM including required Custom Properties
- QSM Correlation rule for events forwarding
- Right-click extension for QRadar
- Saved Search for investigation in Log Activity tab
 

**QSM** is a commercial application by **[ScienceSoft](https://www.scnsoft.com/services/security)** and majority of its functionality is also available for free. You will only need a license if you want to:


- Export all sessions results to Excel
- Open particular session information in QRadar UI (drill-down)


**To request QSM full license, please contact us at:** [qlean@scnsoft.com](mailto:qlean@scnsoft.com)


**[Read More](https://www.scnsoft.com/services/security)**

Digital Shadows monitors and manages digital risk across the widest range of data sources within the open, deep, and dark web to protect an organization’s business, brand, and reputation. The Digital Shadows SearchLight™ service combines scalable data analytics with intelligence analysts to manage and mitigate risks associated with an organization’s cyber threat, data exposure, brand exposure, VIP exposure, infrastructure exposure, physical threat, and third party risk. SearchLight creates an up-to-the minute view of an organization’s external digital risk with tailored threat intelligence. 

The Digital Shadows app imports SearchLight incidents and creates a custom dashboard to provide an overview of your digital risk. This allows easy ingestion of incidents and exposes SearchLight intelligence so that you can make better and faster security decisions.

en.extension_name: Symantec Endpoint Protection Integration for IBM Resilient
en.extension_short_description: The Symantec Endpoint Protection integration with the Resilient platform for querying and updating a SEP deployment.
en.extension_long_description:
Symantec Endpoint Protection (SEP) is a client-server solution that protects laptops, desktops, and servers in a network against malware, risks and vulnerabilities.
This integration allows for the enrichment of Resilient data using the results returned from the SEP API and updates to the SEP environment.

**Key Features:**

The following queries can be executed:
* Execute an Evidence of Compromise (EOC) scan for artifacts of type file (name or path) and hash (MD5, SHA1 or SHA256).
* Get endpoint details or status.
* Get groups.
* Get fingerprint lists.

The following changes can be made to a SEP environment:
* Remediate (quarantine) files (by hash match) discovered in an EOC scan.
* Upload a file from an endpoint to the Symantec Endpoint Protect Manager (SEPM).
* Download a file from the SEPM as base64.
* Add or delete an MD5 hash value from a fingerprint list, which can be used to blacklist files.
* Assign a fingerprint list to a group for system lockdown.
* Delete a fingerprint list.
* Move an endpoint to a new group.
* Quarantine an endpoint.

The integration can also be used to automatically parse email notifications of critical events from the SEPM and create associated Resilient incidents.

**Requirements:**

* Resilient platform is version 32 or later. 
* Symantec Endpoint Protection 14.2 or later.
* Resilient Generic Email Parsing Script 1.0.1 or later.

The remainder of this document describes each included function, how to configure them in custom workflows, and any additional customization options.

en.extension_short_description: MxToolbox integration allows users to execute MxToolbox network diagnostic and lookup tools from the Resilient Platform.
en.extension_long_description:
The MxToolBox API is a RESTful Web Service allowing MxToolbox customers to query the status of their monitors and run lookups (blacklist, smtp, mx, etc.) against artifact values and capture that information for further analysis.

Included in the package are one rule and one workflow as an example of how to invoke the MxToolbox function.

The following MxToolbox commands can be executed:

- blacklist : Check IP or host for reputation
- smtp : Test mail server SMTP (port 25)
- mx : DNS MX records for domain
- a : DNS A record IP address for host name
- spf : Check SPF records on a domain
- txt : Check TXT records on a domain
- ptr : DNS PTR record for host name
- cname : DNS canonical host name to IP address
- whois : Get domain registration information
- arin : Get IP address block information
- soa : Get Start of Authority record for a domain
- tcp : Verify an IP Address allows tcp connections
- http : Verify a URL allows http connections
- https : Verify a URL allows secure http connections
- ping : Perform a standard ICMP ping
- trace : Perform a standard ICMP trace route
- dns : Check your DNS Servers for possible problems

en.extension_short_description: Enables security analysts to understand threats across their virtualized infrastructure.
en.extension_long_description:
VMware AppDefense is a data center endpoint security product that protects applications running in virtualized environments. Rather than chasing after threats, AppDefense understands an application's intended state and behavior, then monitors for changes to that intended state that indicate a threat. When a threat is detected, AppDefense automatically responds.
VMware AppDefense QRadar Application enable security analysts to understand threats and respond faster across their virtualized workloads. QRadar + AppDefense app understands how applications running in virtualized environments are meant to behave, then it monitors changes to that intended state, and enables contextual intelligence alerts when applications deviate from their intended behavior.  
  

**AppDefense QRadar App capabilities:**  
  
AppDefense Alarm Feeds: Enable to surface the authoritative alerts generated by AppDefense.  
Providing Application Context: Provide application context to enrich external QRadar log and alerts through a right-click action.  
Advanced correlation and searches: Link the relevant alerts to AppDefense Console for further investigation.

en.extension_short_description: ETM integrates real-time SAP security into QRadar and includes 300+ threat detection cases ready to run.
en.extension_long_description:
Enterprise Threat Monitor (ETM) monitors SAP systems for threats, such as; misuse of SE16 and SAP debug/replace, connections using DDIC or SAP* user, payment rerouting attacks, opening system for changes, 0-day exploits, and SAP account sharing. 
ETM connects to SAP systems and analyzes various information sources to determine the threats. Analysis includes SAP security logs, system logs, SAP change documents, transport records, user master data changes, ESNCâs fraud related analysis results and many others. ETM correlates these events via user behavior analysis and its SAP-specific attack signatures, including zero-day security vulnerabilities.

ETM uses adaptive noise reduction for eliminating false positives and delivering high quality offense information to QRadar.

This QRadar app (referred to as 'Enterprise Threat Monitor for SAP') allows viewing of pre-correlated offenses, UBA results, and threat dashboards in QRadar and managing SAP security exceptions.

en.extension_short_description: QRadar extension pack for Container Monitoring
en.extension_long_description:
This content pack provides rules to detect Container behaviour. 

The content pack includes IBM custom properties as placeholders, which are meant to be replaced by specific Log Sources Properties. You can download other content extensions that include custom properties with these names, or you can create your own. 

See the documentation for more information on related content packs. 

The use cases covered in this content pack are the following: 
1. Abnormal rights assigned to unauthorized users.
1. Creation of a privileged container is detected.
1. A non-root user with superuser privileges was created.
1. Critical file or directory was mounted to a container.
1. Hostile process, determined by its SHA hash, was detected in a container.
1. Login shell command was overriden.
1. Modification to authorized_key file was detected.
1. Multiple sensitive containers were stopped or deleted in a short period of time. 
1. Privilege added to unauthorized users, followed by suspicious execution of processes.
1. Reverse or bind shell was detected.
1. Detected a user trying to find all SUID/SGID binaries.

The content pack also includes a Pulse Dashboard, which is compatible with the Pulse App.

en.extension_name: Kaspersky Threat Feed App for QRadar
en.extension_short_description: Protect your infrastructure from malware and dangerous URLs with Kaspersky Threat Data Feeds.
en.extension_long_description:
With Kaspersky Threat Feed App for QRadar, log files indexed by your QRadar instance are correlated with Kaspersky Threat Intelligence Data Feeds to detect malicious activity on your enterprise network. You get the real-time awareness needed for highlighting risks and implications associated with security breaches, as well as effectively mitigating cyber threats and defending against attacks even before they are launched.

Kaspersky Threat Feed App for QRadar does a number of things to keep you always informed:
• Displays and prioritizes information about URLs, IP addresses, and file hashes from events that match Kaspersky Threat Intelligence Data Feeds
• Provides lookup of URLs, IP addresses, and hashes in Kaspersky Threat Intelligence Data Feeds via the QRadar Search field
• Provides dashboards for at-a-glance overviews as well as more detailed information on matching events 
• Operationalizes threat intelligence for security/SOC teams and assists threat analyst investigations
• Automatically updates Kaspersky Threat Intelligence Data Feeds from Kaspersky Lab to keep them always up to date
• Supports all your existing security controls as event sources: Firewalls, IPS/IDS, Security Proxies, Anti-Virus solutions, DNS solutions, UTMs and more

Every record in Kaspersky Threat Intelligence Data Feeds is enriched with actionable context (threat names, timestamps, geolocation, resolved IP addresses of infected web resources, hashes, popularity, and more). Contextual data reveals the bigger picture and enables wide-ranging use of this information. Set in context, this data can be efficiently used to answer the who, what, where, and when of attacks by digital adversaries – helping you to make timely decisions and take targeted, proactive actions.
